Mahfuza is a sewer. She sews women's dresses. She began this activity 5 years ago. Mahfuza has her own workshop where she provides services for her clients. Mahfuza also sews children's clothes. 

She uses the profits from the business to buy food items for family use. She lives with the parents of her husband. 

Mahfuza wants to increase her working capital to develop the business. She is asking for a loan of 4,200 TJS to buy an embroidery machine. 

She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Mean

texts.en:
Mean, is 43 years old. She described herself as a small person and a low-educated woman. She couldn’t afford to attend school because of her family’s economic limit. Mean has been in agriculture since she left school, work that she has learned from her parents and older people. She primarily grows rice and sells the products into the market every harvest season. Mean has three children who are attending school and living under her income.

By applying for this loan Mean will use it to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members and so as to improve her household sanitation practices. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Mean is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family, and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members

loans.name: Ol

texts.en:
Ol is 59 years old, married, and has eight children. He lives with his wife and some of his children in Bakan district, Pursat province, Cambodia. As other villagers in the region, Ol is in the business of farming rice and agriculture to earn a living. He has been doing this for more than 20 years and has full support from his wife and children.

By applying for this loan, Ol will use it to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of his family members and so as to improve his household sanitation practices. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Ol is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of his family, and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of his family members

loans.name: Fazolat

texts.en:
Fazolat was born in 1965 in north Tajikistan. She is widowed and has 3 children. Fazolat lives with her family in a rural area. 

Fazolat grows wheat and potatoes. She has her own sowing land. Fazolat also feeds cattle. She has been busy with this business for more than 10 years. 

Her children help her with managing the business. She runs her business well. Fazolat is going to make new sowing, but she has no money. She is asking for a loan of 2,500 TJS to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for the new sowing season. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for the new sowing season

loans.name: Uguloy

texts.en:
Uguloy is 47 years old. She is widowed and has a son who is an adult. Uguloy is also a careful grandmother. She is an ambitious and hardworking woman. 

She has her own business. Uguloy works hard because her business is her only source of income. Uguloy has been running this business for more than 15 years. She buys cattle, feeds it for a few months, and sells it in a local market. Uguloy’s son helps her with feeding the cattle. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy cattle in order to increase her working capital. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies for maintaining her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Oscar Manuel

texts.es:
Oscar es albañil, tiene 53 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está casado su esposa se dedica  a los oficios domésticos, tienen 11 hijos y seis viven con él pues aún son menores de edad y están estudiando, dos de los mayores trabajan. 

Desde hace 30 años se dedica a la albañilería y aprendió de su padre, trabaja en la comunidad y en la ciudad, además tienen 14,000 metros cuadrados de terreno donde siembra maíz a 1 km de su casa y se va caminando. 

Necesita el crédito para la inversión en todas las labores agrícolas,  porque sembrara 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, además comprara abonos, pesticidas y fertilizantes y el pago de mano de obra, sueña a futuro con que sus hijos sean profesionales y ampliar su vivienda, ya que su familia es numerosa y necesita mayor espacio.
texts.en:
Oscar is a bricklayer.  He is 53 years old, and has a 2nd grade education.  He is married, and his wife is a homemaker.  They have 11 children, 6 of whom still live with them, as some of them are still minors and are in school.  Two of their oldest children are working.

Oscar has been working as a bricklayer for 30 years.  He learned this trade from his father.  He works in the community and in the city.  In addition to this, he has 14,000 square meters of land where he grows corn.  The land is located 1 kilometer from his house, and he gets there by walking.

Oscar needs a loan to invest in his farming business, because he will plan 14,000 square meters of corn.  He will also buy chemical and organic fertilizers and pesticides, and will pay for farmhands.  For the future, Oscar dreams of seeing his children become professionals and of expanding his house, because his family is large and they need more space.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Emilya

texts.en:
Emilya is 26 and single with no children. She lives in the Baku region with her family and is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the city of Fuzuli. Emilya runs a consulting business and has previously repaid a Kiva loan on time.

Emilya is requesting a 600 AZN loan to buy a new printer to expand her consulting business. She says a great thanks to Kiva and all lenders for help.

loans.use: to buy a printer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy petrol, kerosene, engine oil, etc., in large quantities to add to her business

loans.name: Zamin

texts.en: Zamin is a taxi driver. He is 23 years old, single and lives with his parents. Zamin’s mother is a housewife, and his father is pensioner. The family lives in the Baku region. It’s noted that Zamin is a taxi driver and now he needs a loan in amount of 700 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to change the tires of his taxi. Therefore, he has applied to Komak. In the future, Zamin wants to change his car and in his personal life he wants to get married and has children. He says great thanks to Kiva for its aid.

loans.use: to change the tires of his taxi

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy palm-oil, onions, margi, pepper, fish, rice, flour, sugar, imported cooking oil, etc., in large quantities to add to her current merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy palm-oil , onions, margi, pepper, fish, rice, flour, gari, sugar, etc., in large quantites to add to her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy large quantities of a wide variety of fruits to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, flour, sugar, beans, gari at wholesales to add to her business

loans.name: Oybiby

texts.en:
Oybiby is 47 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and 8 children in south Tajikistan. She has had her own business for 5 years, and it is her source of income. She sells sunflowers, ice-cream, and drinks.

She does not have many customers and that’s why she's decided to expand the assortment of goods she offers. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 TJS.  With the loan, she is going to buy ice-cream and juice, and always keep her store well-stocked. 

She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy ice-cream and juice

loans.name: Tuhfa

texts.en:
Tuhfa was born in 1995 and is not married. She is a young and purposeful woman who lives with her parents, sister, and brother. Tuhfa began a sewing business two years ago and she sews national women’s dresses as well as European-style clothing. She runs her business well and has her own workshop. Thanks her good service, Tuhfa has regular customers. 

Tuhfa’s brother does not have a job in Tajikistan and he wants to go to Russia. She is requesting a 2,000 TJS loan to buy an air ticket for her brother. Tuhfa must help her brother and she awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy an air ticket for her brother to go to Russia

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothing for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, milk, rice, etc., for her business

loans.name: Komal

texts.en:
Komal is a 38-year-old married woman and the mother of three.  She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing it for the past 7 years and is very knowledgable about stitching techniques. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue her business operations, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a stock of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons to meet up with increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenue to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena de 48 años de edad,  es una persona con excelentes principios y valores, los que la han llevado a ser una mujer muy reconocida en su comunidad, ella se dedica a los oficios domésticos de su hogar también se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos de engorde.  Ella vivió y se  creció junto a sus padres quienes eran personas muy humildes y trabajadoras que también se dedicaban a la venta de pollos y huevos ya que trabajaban en  una granja propia de gallinas ponedoras, su familia contaba con 3 hermanos siendo ella la mayor de todos a quien le correspondía ayudar en los quehaceres del hogar y en la granja;  por ese motivo se le hizo difícil completar sus estudios de educación básica alcanzando únicamente hasta el tercer grado, trascurrió el tiempo y con una edad adecuada conoció al que ahora es su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura y albañilería con quien  son padres de 2 hijos, que se encuentran estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad.

Elena posee una granja de 50 gallinas ponedoras y 50 pollos de engorde realizando estas actividades lleva más de 10 años y continuara haciéndolo, ya que se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos de donde les proporciona ganancias para satisfacer las necesidades básicas de sus hijos a esta actividad se suma su esposo y lo hace por las tardes, ya que las mañanas las dedica a los trabajos de la agricultura.


El dinero será utilizado para comprar pollos y gallinas ponedoras, ya que se le han agotado las existencias y tendrá que comprar más gallinas y pollos y también  una parte del dinero será invertido en mejoramiento de una puerta de la granja y en compra de concentrado para aves.

Los sueños que ella tiene para un futuro son las de tener una granja con las mejores instalaciones, y adquirir un nuevo crédito para la compra de una incubadora de esta forma tendrá mejores ingresos económicos, y apoyar en la educación de sus hijos hasta que sean unos profesionales de éxito, ya que manifiesta que uno de ellos quiere se doctor veterinario.
texts.en:
Elena, 48, is a woman of excellent principles and values, which have led her to be very well known in her community.  She works as a homemaker and also raises and sells chickens.

She lived and grew up with her parents, who were very humble and hardworking people who also sold chickens and eggs because they worked on their own farm raising laying hens.  She was the oldest of three siblings, so she had to help with the household and farm chores.  This is why it was difficult for her to finish her basic education, and she only made it to third grade.  Time went by and at the right age she met the man who is now her husband.  He works in agriculture and construction, and together they're the parents of two children, who attend school in their community.

Elena has a farm with 50 laying hens and 50 chickens for fattening.  She has done this work for more than 10 years and she'll keep on doing it because it has become her main source of income.  She earns profits that pay for her children's basic needs.  Her husband helps her with this job in the afternoon, because in the morning he does his farming activities.

The money will be used to buy chickens and laying hens, because the current ones are depleted. In addition, part of the money will be used to improve a door on the farm and to buy concentrated feed for the birds.

Elena's dreams for the future are to have a farm with the best facilities and to get a new loan to buy an incubator so she'll earn a better income.  She also wants to help her children with their education until they become successful professionals, because one of them wants to be a veterinarian.

loans.use: to buy chickens, hens, and feed, and to fix a door

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.en:
Mukaddas is a young and successful woman. Mukaddas is 24 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. She always wanted to organize her own business. Mukaddas is now going to organize her business in animal husbandry. 

Mukaddas took part in the course ‘To Get Ahead’ by the women's organization and got a certificate. She is glad for the women's organization because she got a lot of useful information. Mukaddas is asking for a loan of 4,000 TJS to buy cattle. She will manage the business alone. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle for organizing her new business.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is fifty-three years old, is a widow,  and has four children.

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. Amelita is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. She has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her general store.

With your help, Amelita can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Mary Ann is thirty-nine years old and has two children who are in school.

Mary Ann's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store and is committed to regain what she lost. Mary Ann is taking out a PHP 10,000 Housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Mary Ann has been with NWTF since 2011 in her effort to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Mary Ann would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is fifty-two years old, married, and has eight children.  She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Adela is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 9,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. She has been an NWTF borrower since 2011. She plans to recover through selling flowers.

With your help, Adela can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bananas, oranges, potatoes, etc., for her business

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en: Rashida is 25 years old and enjoys doing hand embroidery. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her territory and she earns a good amount of income to support her family.  In order to meet her growing demand of embroidery, she needs to buy more frames, needles and threads in different colors. For this reason she applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation.  It will help her in completing the orders of her customers on time.  She is in her 4th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more frames, needles and threads in different colors

loans.name: Nuraiym

texts.ru: Нурайым 29 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Нурайым - высшее образование.Она очень трудолюбивая и ответственная. Животноводством Нурайым стала заниматься с 2008 года с 35,000 сом (KGS). Сегодня в ее хозяйстве насчитываются 4 дойные коровы, 13 овец, 11 коз и 2 лошади. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нурайым обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом для покупки скота, а именно, она хочет приобрести  коров для разведения. Увеличение поголовья скота непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита Нурайым планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее улучшение условий проживания.
texts.en: Nuriaym is 29 years old, married, and, with her husband, is raising two children.  Nuraiym has a higher education.  She is very hardworking and responsible.  Beginning in 2008 with 35,000 KGS, Nuraiym starting working in animal husbandry.  Nuraiym now has in her care 4 milk cows, 13 sheep, 11 goats, and 2 horses.  Her monthly income is 10,500 KGS.  With the goal of increasing her business, Nuraiym turned to the bank "Bai-Tushum" for a loan to purchase cattle.  Specifically, she wants to purchase cows for breeding.  Increasing the number of livestock will inevitably lead to an increase in the family's capital.  With the income she receives from the loan, Nuraiym plans to save towards further increasing the size of her domestic herd, and also plans to set aside money to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 27-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts in years. She is the mother of two children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food and clothing for their health. 

She wants to expand her business so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy packs of rice, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is in her 3rd loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy packs of rice, biscuits and beverages

loans.name: Therese

texts.fr: Thérèse est une jeune femme de 42 ans, divorcée et mère de 03 enfants dont le plus âgé a 16 ans et le moins âgé 10 ans. Elle gère un débit de boisson dans un quartier de la place depuis 03 ans. Son activité se porte bien et la demande se sa clientèle se fait de plus en plus grandissante c'est pour cela qu'elle sollicite votre aide afin d'augmenter son stock de marchandise et améliorer la vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Thérèse is a young woman of 42. She is divorced and a mother of three: her oldest is sixteen and her youngest ten.

She has been managing a small bar in one of the city's neighborhood for three years. Business is good, and demand from her clientele is increasing. This is why she is requesting your help to increase her store of merchandise and improve her family's life.

loans.use: increase her stock of merchandise (beverages).

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 35-year-old married woman. For the past three years Zahida has been running her business selling milk. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family. With the passage of time, her sales increased and also her income. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. 

She has some savings and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is in her third loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Sheedan

texts.en:
Sheedan has successfully built her business selling milk with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. Previously with the help of a Kiva loan, she purchased a milking buffalo to inflate her sales. She counts a good client list and earns a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. 

She has some savings and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income through her larger sales. She is in her seventh loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Munwar

texts.en:
Munwar is a 51-year-old married woman. Her husband is an electrician but his income is not enough for meeting their household expenditures. That is why she started a small general store at the corner of her house to contribute to the family income. She has 10 years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

Munwar is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy stock of juices, salts, oil, sugar, grains, biscuits and some packs of soaps to meet the increasing demand of her customers. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is in her third loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy stock of juices, salts, oil, sugar, grains, biscuits and some packs of soaps.

loans.name: Shehla

texts.en:
Shehla is a 47-year-old married woman. She deals in the business of selling cloth in her locality. She buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.  

She is requesting a 40,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez is a 45 year old married woman. She has been running a business selling milk for 3 years. She has two cows and sells their milk to many of her neighbors along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk.  She looks after the cows and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis. They are happily doing it together to support their family. 

She has seven children and is motivated to provide them with good food and clothing to ensure their health. In order to make huge profits, she requested for a loan of 35,000 PKR to buy one more cow to cater to more customers.  She expects a boost in her sales and profits.

loans.use: to buy one more cow

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: Sonia is 20 years old and is married.  She is in the business of selling animals with the support of her husband. She buys baby goats at low prices, brings them up, and then her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more baby goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and increase her income level.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats.

loans.name: Alizbeth

texts.en: Alizbeth has successfully built her business of parrot sales with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva.  She has been doing it for many years and has become popular for providing colorful parrots. She counts with a good client list. Previously with the help of a Kiva loan she purchased a variety of parrots to increase her sales. Now she is in her 4th loan cycle and applied a loan of 45,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan amount to purchase different types of parrots such as Australian parrots, macaw and fishers.  She expects a boost in her sales and profits.

loans.use: to purchase different types of parrots such as Australian parrots, macaw and fishers

loans.name: Haseena

texts.en:
Haseena is 31 years old and is married. The man shown in the photo is Haseena’s husband who is a tailor by profession. He has expertise in stitching and is using his skills to provide financial support to his family. By now he has attained a good number of customers. For the improvement of her husband’s business, Haseena has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR. Haseena's husband wants to purchase spools of threads along with packs of laces, ribbons, and zippers. It will help him to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthier source of income. 

Haseena dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase spools of threads along with packs of laces, ribbons, and zippers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for an efficient cooking gas package so that he can provide his children with warm food

loans.name: Farrah

texts.en: Farrah is a 35 years old married woman. She has been in the beauty parlor business for twelve years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. By providing excellent services she has become very popular in her street. In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying a variety of cosmetic products for the parlor. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She is hopeful to cater to more customers.  She is in her 4th loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities

loans.name: Firdous

texts.en: Firdous is a 56 year old married woman and the mother of three children.  One of her sons (also shown in the photo) is a rickshaw driver and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now the rickshaw requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional order.  For this reason, Firdous has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR for her son. He wants to buy new tires and some spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Firdous is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and some spare parts

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida has successfully built her wood selling business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She is very experienced in her work and she earns a good amount of income to bear the household expenditures.

Previously, with the help of a Kiva loan, she improved her business. Now again she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR. It will be used to purchase good quality wood of different types with some cutters. It will allow her to consistently meet the increasing demands of her customers. She is in her 5th loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase good quality wood.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her 2012 and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF. It will be used to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, Saturnina will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner. In the future, Saturnina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Ida

texts.en:
Ida is forty two years old,married and has ten children. Eight of the children are in school.  Ida works very hard to provide for them.

Ida's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Ida has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Ida has taken a 10,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Ida is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Ma. Annabelle

texts.en:
Ma. Annabelle is 26 years old with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ma. Annabelle's house was destroyed by the super typhoon, Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her fish business (buying and selling) and is committed to regaining what she lost. Ma. Annabelle is taking out a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF. It will be used to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Ma. Annabelle has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Ma. Annabelle would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is forty-six years old with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Linda's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Linda has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. Linda has taken a PHP 8,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

Linda is committed to rebuilding her devastated life. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her busines and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

With your help Shirley will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is forty-seven years old and married with five children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Her business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Vicenta has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 1,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Vicenta is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Jill

texts.en:
Jill is thirty years old and has one child. 

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Jill is taking out a housing loan amounting of 10,000 PHP to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

She has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. and plans to recover through her food vending business.

With your help, Jill can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Charlene

texts.en:
Charlene works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a 10,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help Charlene will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Charlene would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is forty five years old, married and has six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Joy's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Joy has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Joy has taken a 10,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Joy is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is thirty three years old, married and has two children who are in school.

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Arlyn is taking out a housing loan amount of 10,000 PHP to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

She has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. She plans to recover financially through her general store business.

With your help, Arlyn can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is twenty seven years old, single and has two children who are in school, Marina works very hard to provide for them.

Marina's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Marina has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Marina has taken a 5,500 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Marina is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Madilyn

texts.en:
Madilyn is twenty-seven years old, married, and has three children.  She and her family survived super-typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Madilyn is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 5,000 purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. She has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. She plans to recover through her general store business.

With your help, Madilyn can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super-typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is married with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Elisa is thirty-seven years old and has one child who is in school.

Elisa's house was destroyed by super-typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her food-vending business and is committed to regain what she lost. Elisa is taking out a PHP 8,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Elisa has been with NWTF since 2011 in her quest to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Elisa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 6,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Delma will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Delma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Egliceria

texts.en:
Egliceria is sixty-two years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Egliceria's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Egliceria has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 7,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor. Egliceria is committed to rebuilding her devastated life. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Vilma is forty years old and has three children who are in school.

Vilma's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Vilma is taking out a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a family home.

Vilma has been with NWTF since 2011 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Vilma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Begilia

texts.en:
Begilia is 56 years old and has nine children. She is married and three of her children are currently in school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Begilia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in pig fattening for eight years now, and has borrowed eleven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Begilia would like to save enough money so to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Miguela is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

Emalinda is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.name: Leonides

texts.en:
Leonides is fifty eight years old, married and has six children, three are in school.   

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Leonides is taking out a housing loan amount of 8,500 PHP to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

She has been an NWTF borrower since 2012 and plans to recover financially through her general store business.

With your help, Leonides can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa is 28 years old, married and has two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Melissa's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her buying and selling fish business and is committed to regain what she lost. Melissa is taking out a 10,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Melissa has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Melissa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is a 36-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has 4 years of experience in this field.  Her husband assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. Shazia is a mother of 4 children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation to buy packs of salts, biscuits, grains, and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is in her 4th loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, grains, and beverages.

loans.name: Hina

texts.en: Hina is a 31-year-old married woman. She has been running a school for many years. She has gained a good number of students and is well respected in her community. She is contributing much to the family income through all of her great efforts.  In order to accommodate more students in her school, Hina requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase a couple of school benches and chairs along with a new blackboard. She expects more admissions as her school becomes famous in her town. She desires to spend part of the revenues on the expansion of her school.

loans.use: to purchase a couple of school benches and chairs along with a new blackboard.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat, age 21, is a married woman. She has been in the business of selling embroidered cloth for a period of about 4 years.  Her designs are in high demand and she has managed to acquire a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy bundles of cloth along with reels of threads and packs of beads and stones for its embellishment. In this way, she will be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful that she will be able to increase her income by targeting more customers. She is in her 4th loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy bundles of cloth along with reels of threads and packs of beads and stones.

loans.name: Xalig

texts.en:
Xalig is a car mechanic. He is single and does not have any children. Xalig is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city and now lives in the Baku region with his family. Xalig is a car mechanic and rents an auto repair shop; here he provides car repair services. He learned this profession from his mentor and already has 3 years of experience in this business. Today Xalig needs a loan in the amount of 1,200 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy spare car parts.  He is thankful to the Kiva organization for help. 

In the future, Xalig wants to expand his auto repair shop and in his personal life he wants to get married.

loans.use: to buy spare car parts.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is fifty four years old, married and has one child.  

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Dioscora is taking out a housing loan amount of 7,000 PHP to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

She has been a NWTF borrower since 2013. and plans to recover financially through her general store business.

With your help, Dioscora can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Babiola

texts.en:
Babiola is 54 years old and married with seven children. With one child currently in school, Babiola works very hard to provide for them.

Babiola runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF. It will be used to buy additional stocks, such as rice, sugar, detergent soap, coffee, and canned goods to sell. Babiola has been in this business for 7 years and she sells a variety of items. Babiola would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, such as rice, sugar, detergent soap, coffee, and canned goods.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF. It will be used to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family. With your help, Marilyn will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Marilyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana is a 50-year-old married woman who is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marciana's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her food vending and is committed to regaining what she lost. Marciana is taking out a PHP 9,500 housing loan through NWTF. It will be used to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor for her family home.

Marciana has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Marciana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a housing loan through NWTF. It will be used to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor so she could build family home.

With your help Gloria will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner. In the future, Gloria would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is forty-five years old and married with eight children. With six children in school, Leonila works very hard to provide for them.

Leonila's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Leonila has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Leonila has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. Leonila is committed to rebuilding her devastated life. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Sarafeen

texts.en: At the age of 32, Sarafeen is running a general store at the corner of her house with the support of her husband. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. By this time Sarafeen has attained a good number of customers.  She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 40-year-old married woman. She is in the business of selling milk. She has 2 calves and 1 cow in milk production. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to give her a decent life. She has 6 children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good food, health, and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet day-to-day expenses of life.

This is her 4th year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business with support from Kashf. Now she requested a loan of 45,000 Rs to purchase one more cow. She hopes to have an increase in the production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in generating more revenue.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Misbha

texts.en: Misbha is a 27-year-old married woman; she has been in the business of selling crockery for 2 years. She offers various types of crockery such as glasses, dinner sets, bowls, etc. Her husband also assists her in selling items to the people of their community and in the local market. Misbha makes a sufficient amount of income to contribute in the family income. For the improvement of her business she contacted the Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR. With these funds she will be able to purchase a variety of crockery such as tea sets, bowls, and glasses in various sizes and designs. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.  She is in her 4th loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of crockery such as tea sets, bowls, and glasses in various sizes and designs.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
Demetria is 54 years old and is married with 9 children. 

Demetria is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Demetria requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Demetria has been in the pig-fattening business for 7 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Demetria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Cherry Lou

texts.en:
Cherry Lou is 27 years old and has 4 children, 2 of whom are in school.  

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Her business and family home were wiped out. 

Cherry Lou is taking out a housing loan amounting to 2,500 Php in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Cherry Lou has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. She plans to recover through her general store business.

With your help, Cherry Lou can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Banco Mujer De Paraiso Group

texts.es: Mercedes tiene 54 años de edad, es casada, actualmente vive con tres de sus hijos, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y reconocida en la zona ya que toda su vida ha trabajado por y para el beneficio de su familia, ya que en la zona no existen fuentes de empleo y son pocos los habitantes, por lo que ella decide iniciar con la crianza de cerdos, gallinas y pollos. Estos animales llevan su proceso de cuidados correctamente y se venden con facilidad en la zona. Doña Mercedes aprendió todo el cuidado de estos animales sola; ya que su esposo sale desde la madrugada a trabajar y regresa por las tardes. Ella junto con sus hijos se encargan del cuidado y mantenimiento de las porquerizas y gallineros. Desde niña ella desempeña esta labor y la ha transmitido a sus hijos ya que si desean continuar estudiando deben ayudarla para tener el dinero para viajar una hora hasta el centro de estudio. Ella comenta que cuando las cosas cuestan al final se disfrutan mejor, por eso ella sueña con ver a sus hijos graduarse de la universidad y trabajar en algo menos duro que lo que ella realiza. Mercedes solicita este dinero para comprar cerdos de engorde ya que es una buena época para empezar a criarlos. Eligió Fundación Mujer ya que tomo en cuenta atender una zona que para ellas ha sido olvidada por el país. Ya que han sufrido por la falta de luz y agua potable, deben realizar pozos para tener el agua por lo menos para las necesidades básicas. Es una zona de campo que llaman Paraíso ya que la mayoría son mujeres y muy trabajadoras. Espera le podamos apoyar para cumplir su sueño de madre y llevar el sustento al hogar.
texts.en: Mercedes, 54, is married and lives with her three children. She's a very hard worker who is recognized in her area since she's been working there all of her life for the benefit of her family; in her area there aren't many jobs and there are few people, so she decided to start her own business breeding pigs, hens and chickens. These animals are properly taken care of and are easily sold in the area. Mercedes learned to take care of the animals by herself as her husband leaves in the early morning and comes back in the evening. She and her children are in charge of caring for the pigpens and chicken coops. She's been doing this kind of work since she was a little girl and has taught her children how to do it because if they want to continue studying, they need to make some money to afford the the 1-hour trip to school. She says that when it's tough to accomplish something, in the end, you enjoy it more. That's why she dreams of seeing her children graduate from university and get less-strenuous jobs than hers. Mercedes is requesting a loan to buy pigs for fattening as it's a good time to start breeding them. She chose Women's Foundation (Fundación Mujer) Communal Bank because the women in this group live in an area that has been forgotten by the country. They've suffered a lack of electricity and potable water; they are in need of wells and potable water to cover their basic needs. It's an area in the country that is called "Paradise" and most of the people are hard-working women. She hopes we can both help her make her dream for her children come true and help her cover the household expenses.

loans.use: Buy pigs for fattening.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the most efficient cooking energy from liquefied petroleum gas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to improve and help her coffee crop.

loans.name: Jonnavel

texts.en:
Jonnavel works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a 10,000 Philippines Pesos housing loan through NWTF to buy building materials and to pay for construction labor, so she can build a house for her family.

With your help Jonnavel will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Jonnavel would like to strengthen and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a clean cooking gas system

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a clean and thermally efficient cooking gas package

loans.name: Edwin Bladimir

texts.es: Edwin tiene 35 años de edad y reside junto a su compañera de vida y su suegra. Edwin posee una pequeña tienda en la cual comercializa variedad de productos de primera necesidad como: frijoles, arroz, azúcar, sal, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. Su negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos por lo que desea mantenerlo activo por mucho más tiempo. Edwin solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de más productos de tienda (cereales, detergente, golosinas, huevos, etc.) para satisfacer una mayor demanda que le permita aumentar sus ventas y sus ingresos y de igual forma sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en: Edwin, 35, lives with his life partner and mother-in-law. Edwin owns a little store in which he sells a variety of basic-need products, like beans, rice, sugar, salt, candy, sweet bread, etc. His business is his principal source of income and he'd like to keep it open for a long time. Edwin is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in buying more products for his store (cereals, detergent, candy, eggs, etc.) in order to satisfy a greater demand, which will increase his sales and his income and, by the same measure, his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: buy cereals, detergents, candy, eggs, etc., for his store.

loans.name: Madina

texts.ru: Мадине 47 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Мадины- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, стартовав в 1989 году, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Мадины, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 10 овец, 1 теленок, а также есть земельный надел размером 2,40 ГА, на котором она выращивает картофель, перец, кукурузу и клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет 16,000 сом (KGS). Мадина является участником группы "Береке Талас", в которой кроме нее состоит еще 3 человека. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мадина обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом  на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет накопить средства на покупку трактора.
texts.en: Madina is 47 years old, married, and, together with her husband, is raising 3 children.  Madina has a secondary education.  Madina's work in animal husbandry, beginning in 1989 with the purchase of cattle for 5,000 KGS, serves as the main source of income for her family.  Thanks to Madina's hard work, she now has in her care 2 milk cows, 10 sheep, and 1 calf.  She also has a 2.4 hectare plot of land, on which she grows potatoes, peppers, corn, and clover.  Her monthly income is 16,000 KGS.  Madina is a member of the group "Bereke Talas," which consists of herself and three other people.  With the goal of increasing her business, Madina turned to the Bank "Bai-Tushum" for a loan to purchase cows for breeding.  With the income from the loan, she plans to invest in further increasing her number of livestock, and also hopes to save towards purchasing a tractor.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Dinara

texts.ru: Динара обращается в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом уже во второй раз. Она является лидером группы "Ийгилик-3", кроме нее в группе состоят еще 2 человека. Полученный ранее кредит позволил Динаре развить ее бизнес до 1 дойной коровы, 1 теленка, 1 лошади и 25 овец. Также Динара увеличила и размер земельного надела до 3,0 ГА, где на сегодняшний день она выращивает фасоль. На полученный кредит Динара планирует приобрести бычков и расширить свою деятельность. Прибыль от кредита позволит Динаре улучшить материальное состояние семьи и дать образование детям.
texts.en: This is Dinara's second time turning to the Bank "Bai-Tushum" for a loan.  She is the leader of the group "Iigilik-3," which consists of herself and 2 other people.  With the help of her first loan, Dinara, was able to grow her business to 1 milk cow, 1 calf, 1 horse, and 25 sheep.  Dinara also has a 3.0 hectare plot of land, on which she grows beans.  With her new loan, Dinara plans to purchase steers and continue to expand her business.  Income from this loan will allow Dinara to improve her family's material living conditions, and provide education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase steers

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is fifty-eight years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rosita's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Rosita has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has asked for a 10,000 Philippines Pesos housing loan through NWTF to buy materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to buy building materials and to pay for construction labor.

Rosita is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in the future would like to strengthen and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy agricultural supplies to cultivate her coffee crops.

loans.name: Cristobal Daniel

texts.es: Cristóbal Daniel, mayor de edad casado con un hijo menor de edad, aun bajo su responsabilidad, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por sus hermosas playas, el turismo y el comercio, En la vida ha sido muy luchador, trabajador con ganas de superación personal, para cumplir cada uno de sus sueños y metas.  No logra terminar sus estudios concluyo la secundaria  debido escasos  recursos económicos en su familia no pudo estudiar, Hoy en día su sueño es ver formado a su hijo en un profesional, Cristóbal Daniel, es un microempresario que se dedica a la compra venta de mercadería en general como: pantalones, camisas, vestidos, short, camisetas, ropa interior, cosméticos, perfumes, artículos escolares. Productos plásticos,  inicia su jornada diaria desde muy temprano dedicándole una 8 horas diarias de forma ambulante y por encargos de sus clientes, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales,  sus compras las realiza al contado en mercados de mayoreos de otros municipios y a distribuidores, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito recuperando semanal y quincenal lo invertido, El objetivo de este financiamiento es para  invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería,  para lograr cubrir varios pedidos que tiene de sus clientes y obtener mejores ingresos, Cristóbal Daniel  agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kivas les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Cristóbal Daniel is an adult married man with a young child for whom he is responsible. He is originally from one of the towns in Chinandega which is located in the western part of the country. This area is known for its beautiful beaches, tourism, and the retail trade. Throughout his life, Cristóbal has been a very determined and hard worker who has the drive to succeed on a personal level. This has allowed him to accomplish each of his goals and dreams. He was not able to finish his high school studies. Since his family had limited financial resources, Cristóbal could not continue his education. Today he dreams of seeing his son become a professional.

Cristóbal Daniel is a small entrepreneur who has a business of buying and selling general merchandise such as trousers, shirts, dresses, shorts, T-shirts, undergarments, cosmetics, perfumes, school supplies, and plastic goods. His daily schedule begins very early and he spends approximately eight hours each day as a traveling vendor, taking orders from his customers, both established and occasional. He makes his purchases with cash at the wholesale markets in other towns and from distributors. His sales are conducted with cash or on credit, and then he collects payments on a weekly or bi-weekly basis.

The purpose of this loan is to invest it as operating capital so that he can restock his business of buying and selling merchandise. This will allow him to fulfill the various orders from his customers so that he can generate more income. Cristóbal Daniel appreciates the assistance that Kiva lenders provide to people who have limited resources and come from poor countries, such as Nicaragua, so that then can earn a decent living.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise including clothes, shirts, dresses, cosmetics, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for an efficient cooking gas package

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is thirty-seven years old and married. She has three children who are of school-age.

Elizabeth and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Elizabeth has asked for a housing loan of 9,500 Philippines Pesos to buy building materials, and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Elizabeth has been an NWTF borrower since 2011. She plans to repay this loan though the profits from her through her general store.

With your help, Elizabeth can rebuild her house and recover from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 59 years old, and married with four children. 

Edna is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Edna has asked for a 20,000 Philippines Pesos loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Edna has been in pig fattening for eight years now, and has successfully borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to support her business.

In the future, Edna would like to repair and renovate her family home with some of the money she plans to make from her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 61 years old and married with eight children. For the past eight years she has worked hard raising and fattening pigs to sell.

Lorna is applying for a 21,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
El socio es una persona responsable y se sigue cuidando en su salud,el sueño del socio es tener una tienda de artesania.El socio solicita el credito para comprar medicamentos para su salud.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower is a responsible person who continues to look after his health. His dream is to have a handicraft shop. He is requesting a loan in order to buy medicines for his health.

The borrower is pleased with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: to buy medicines.

loans.name: Mario Obdulio

texts.es: Mario tiene 50 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su madre de 77 años de edad quien depende de él económicamente. Mario trabaja como albañil desde hace 25 años y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar. Con mucho entusiasmo y humildad se acerco a FUSAI para solicitar este crédito para invertir en la construcción de un muro de retención para lo cual necesita comprar materiales como: ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro. Espera poder contar  con este financiamiento y así poder contar con mayor seguridad tanto para sus pocas pertenencias como para su familia.
texts.en:
Mario is 50 years old and resides in his own home along with his 77-year-old mother who is financially dependent on him. He has been working as a bricklayer for the past 25 years in order to sustain his household.

With great enthusiasm and humility, Mario approached FUSAI about requesting a loan. He will invest in the construction of a retention wall, so he needs to buy materials such as bricks, cement, sand, and iron. Mario hopes to receive this loan so that he can have greater security and protect the few belongings that his family owns.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, and iron for building a retention wall.

loans.name: Marianida

texts.en:
Marianida is married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marianida is thirty-eight years old and has two children who are in school.

Marianida's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Marianida is taking out a 9,000 Philippine Pesos housing loan through NWTF to buy building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a new house for her family.

Marianida has been borrowing from NWTF since 2011 in her journey rising out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, she would like to strengthen and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business, and is now asking for a 9,500 Philippines Pesos housing loan through NWTF to buy building materials and to pay for construction labor, so she can build a house for her family.

With your help she will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Rosalina would like to strengthen and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita, 49, is married and has ten children, four of whom are currently in school. For the past twenty years she has worked hard making and selling charcoal.

Nenita is applying for a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more coconut shells to make her charcoal. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more coconut shells to make her charcoal.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is forty years old and married with two children. She has been raising and selling pigs for the past twelve years. She also earns money through her food sales and sari sari, or general store.

Rebecca is is applying for a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines and other supplies for her pigs. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to be successful enough to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new sewing and overlock machines, a table and fabric

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.en:
Rafaela is 59 years old and married with five children. For the past eighteen years she has been farming vegetables. She also earns an income buying and selling livestock.

Rafaela is applying for a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy seed, fertilizer and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly to attain her dream: to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and over sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy an iron, table and sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for education fees.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more goods and renovate his shop.

loans.name: Margarita De La Concepcion

texts.es: La maravillosa y gran belleza de la Reserva Natural Volcán Mombacho nos revela un gran diversidad de fauna y de especies única de la región así como sus habitantes con su hospitalidad donde la Joven Margarita no será excepción quien nos recibe con los brazos abiertos en su negocio de venta de granos básicos (arroz, azúcar, frijoles), gaseosa, y golosinas; es una joven de 24 años de edad, con ánimos de oportunidades de crecimiento de su negocio; gracias a un primer financiamiento que adquirió en KIVA ha logrado que su negocio creciera en gran manera, aumentado su inventario y obtener nuevos productos que no presentaba en su negocio; ella solicita un nuevo crédito para la compra de nuevos insumos tanto de granos básicos, gaseosa, golosinas, aceite, lácteos, carne de res y pollo entre otros; estimando que el nuevo crédito a solicitud le será de muchísima utilidad porque podrá expandir más negocio, podrá incrementar más sus ventas y hacer otra pequeña sucursal de venta de su negocio.
texts.en:
The marvelous and great beauty of the Mombacho Volcano Natural Reserve reveals a great diversity of wildlife, as well as species that are unique to the region. The same can be said about the residents and their hospitality. Margarita is a young woman who is no exception. She welcomes with open arms everyone who comes to her business where she sells basic necessities (rice, sugar, and beans), sodas, and snack foods. Margarita, age 24, is excited about the opportunity to grow her business.

Thanks to the first loan that she acquired through Kiva, she was able to grow her business in a large way. She increased her inventory and obtained new products to display in her business. Margarita is requesting a new loan so that she can buy a new supply of basic staples, sodas, snack foods, oil, dairy products, beef, chicken, and other products. She expects the new loan she requested to be very useful because she will be able to expand her business even more. As a result, she will increase her sales and be able to open another small sales location for her business.

loans.use: to buy basic staples, sodas, snack foods, oil, dairy products, beef, chicken, and other products.

loans.name: Thabyan Group

texts.en:
This group is called Thabyan and is composed of four women. They applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB.

The president of the group is Salwa. She is 23 years old, a widow, and has two children. She works selling perfumes and incense door to door. She lives with her children in Hodeidah, Yemen. After her husband died, she assumed all the responsibility for her children. In order to provide her children with the necessary needs, she began her own business. She makes modest profits; unfortunately, all of her profits go to the children's expenses. On the other hand, she wants to enlarge her business. Therefore, she applied for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to buy more incense and perfumes and resell them. In this way, she will increase her working capital and improve her business. Her reason for applying for this loan is a lack of capital. Salwa faces many challenges in her business, including increasing her client base, and she will use the profits to improve the quality of life for her children.

Salwa looks forward to providing her children with a lot of money and sending her youngest child to a private school.

loans.use: to buy more incense and perfumes to resell

loans.name: Chuyen's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Chuyen, is the Thai ethnic person, born in 1970. She lives with her husband and 2 children. She has participated in group’s activities since January in 1998, so far she has a strong attachment to the institution for 16 years. She currently is the leader of the group with 5 members.

Her family lives mainly on farming, animal husbandry and sideline job is cooking wine to sell for shops in the village. Whereby, she also has more income to cover school fees for her children. However, feeding 2 children and paying for their learning cause her family life difficulties.

She needs to borrow a loan to offset tuition costs for her children, and she will try to find another job in order to have an amount to monthly pay on time for the institution.

Chuyen desires a loan because it will be a great help for her family and her 2 children to have conditions to study and have a brighter future.

loans.use: to offset tuition costs for her children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Al- Rysala Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al- Rysala and consists of four women living in Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 95,000 YER from AMB.

Fatima, 39 years old, has three sons. She is a hardworking married woman who is very dedicated to what she sets out to do. In the beginning her husband was an emigrant in Saudi Arabia. Because of the crisis of the emigration between Yemen and the Saudi Kingdom, most of the Yemeni emigrants came back home. Fatima's husband was one of them.
