Soledad is 30 years old and a businesswoman. She completed up to fourth grade at primary school. She is married - her husband is a security guard - and the couple has two children who live at home. The eldest child is in second grade at school. Soledad and her husband are responsible for covering household costs. Since she was 16 years old, Soledad has worked with her mother selling clothes and, by doing this work, she learned to run her own business.

Soledad currently works going out to sell clothes and accessories in nearby communities. She travels by bus and has no fixed working hours, though she usually works from 7 a.m. until 4 p.m. Soledad is applying for this loan because she wants to expand her business and to buy shirts and underwear for men and women, as well as women's accessories. This will improve her quality of life as she will sell more and earn higher profits to continue investing in her business. In the future, Soledad would like to have a market stall to sell clothes. She also wants her children to study in order to have a profession.

loans.use: to buy shirts and underwear for men and women, as well as women's accessories.

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es:
María Francisca tiene 41 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Morropon una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre, que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas, bebidas y servicio de fotocopias y venta de ropa a pedidos, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de ropa para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
María Francisca is 41 years old, she lives together with her husband and sons in the district of Morropon, a community with a warm climate, its population makes its living in agriculture, commerce and cattle rearing, it is located in the province with the same name to belong to the region of Piura, in the northern coast of Peru.

María Francisca makes her living selling sweets, drinks and offering a photocopy service, and selling clothes to order. She has sought a loan for 500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to buy a variety of clothes to offer to her customers and in this manner generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes to offer to her customers.

loans.name: Elen

texts.en:
Elen works hard to support her family. Elen is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Elen requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Elen has been in this business for four years now.

Elen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is twenty three years old, married and the mother of two children. 

Lorena and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Lorena is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for the construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Lorena has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her general store business.

With your help, Lorena can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is twenty six years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Mirasol works very hard to provide for them.

Mirasol's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Mirasol has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with a safe shelter.

Miasol has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for the construction labor.

Mirasol is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Reyna tiene 47 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo. Ella se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir como: faldas, vestidos y blusas. Tiene 18 años de contar con este negocio lo cual le permite llevar el sustento a su familia y mantener la economía del hogar junto a su esposo. Reyna solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un cuarto para la cocina y encementar el piso del corredor para lo cual necesita materiales como: ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y dar inicio a las mejoras lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Reyna is 47 years old and she lives in her own home together with her husband. She makes her living making clothes such as skirts, dresses and blouses. She has been working in this area for 18 years and it has allowed her to support her family and maintain the household's income together with her husband. 

Reyna is seeking this loan from FUSAI to invest in the construction of a room for the kitchen and to lay down cement on the floor of the hallway for which she will need materials such as bricks, cement, sand and iron. She hopes to obtain this financing and start the improvements as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand and iron to build a room for the kitchen and to lay cement on the floor of the corridor in the house.

loans.name: Anna Marie

texts.en:
Anna Marie works hard to support her family. Anna Marie has a buy and sell vegetables and spices business in the Philippines.

Anna Marie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of vegetables and spices to sell.

Anna Marie has been in this business for 13 years now.

In the future, Anna Marie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of vegetables and spices to sell

loans.name: Feleciana

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Feleciana works hard to support her family.

Feleciana has a business renting video game machines in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from pig fattening and coconut wine vending. Feleciana is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy an additional video gaming machine and spare parts for her business.

Feleciana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy an additional video gaming machine and spare parts for her business

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is 37 years old and married with three children who are in school. Florenda works very hard to provide for them.

Florenda runs a buy and sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of nipa to sell.

Florenda has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Florenda would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of nipa to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy items such as flour, oil, and potatoes.

loans.name: Al- Fakher Rim Group

texts.en:
Al- Fakher Rim is a group from four women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Latifa is the leader of the group. She is a 44-year-old married woman who lives with her family in Sana'a, Yemen. She works as a housewife, and she is a very active and dynamic woman.  

Latifa's house lacks of a lot of home appliances, and she wants to improve the condition of things in her house. Most of time her husband goes to his work and comes back late in the evening, and her children go to school. Latifa stays alone in the house. She can't leave her house and go to stay with her women friends. For this reason, she feels nervous and pessimist.  

Therefore, Latifa is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a TV for the house.

Latifa looks forward to opening a saving account in AMB Bank. Her dream is to send her children to a private school.

loans.use: To purchase a TV for the house

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a general store business in the Philippines. Merlinda has been in this business for five years now.

Merlinda requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Glory Jean

texts.en:
Glory Jean is 32 years old and married with one child. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. 

Glory Jean is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Glory Jean has been in this business for three years, and also earns additional income from buying and selling lumber.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 55 years old and married.  She works very hard.

Regina runs a buy and sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of nipa to sell.

Regina has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of nipa to sell

loans.name: Los Lirios Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Los Lirios” está constituida por 06 socias emprendedoras que han ido mejorando en el transcurso del tiempo. Este es el caso de Isabel de 48 años casada con 01 hijo aún dependiente. Hace 05 años que se dedica a la venta de productos naturales. Actualmente le va bien, pues dicho negocio le ha permitido mejorar su situación económica. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de extracto de rana, algarrobina y jalea real. Seguir implementando su negocio es su mayor deseo. El grupo “Los Lirios” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito, ya que permite su progreso. Isabel es la tercera del lado derecho, viste polo marrón.
texts.en:
The “Los Lirios” communal bank is made up of six enterprising members who have improved their lot in life over time. This is the case of Isabel, 48, who is married and has one dependent child. For the last five years she has been making her living selling natural products. It is going well for her as this business has allowed her to improve her financial situation. 

She has sought the loan to buy extract of frog, carob and royal jelly. To continue in the business is her greatest dream. The “Los Lirios” group is grateful to the people that made this loan possible as it enables their progress. Isabel is the third person on the right-hand side, she is wearing a brown T-shirt.

loans.use: to buy extract of frog, carob and royal jelly.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Elisa works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Elisa is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Elisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for an efficient cooking gas package

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a more efficient cooking gas package using Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a clean and efficient cooking gas package

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for an efficient cooking gas package using Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for an efficient cooking gas package using Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Herjen

texts.en:
Herjen is 30 years old and married with one child in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Herjen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.  She has been in this business for 22 years.
  
Herjen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Maura works hard to support her family.

Maura has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she also earns income from motorcycle transportation.  

Maura is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy a fishing net for her fishing business.

Maura has sustained her business with the help of seven previous loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net.

loans.name: Lany

texts.en:
Lany is 28 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lany runs a hardware store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Lany has been in this business for one year. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell .

loans.name: Tatah

texts.en:
Tatah is a hardworking entrepreneur who runs a buy and sell pearl business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to purchase pearls to sell.

Tatah has been in this business for nine years. Tatah earns additional income from fishing.

Tatah has sustained her business through her efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase pearl to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Emma works hard to support her family.

Emma has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she also earns income by running a general store. 

Emma is borrowing PHP 19500 through NWTF to purchase fishing materials like a net, gasoline, bamboo, etc for her fishing business.

Emma has sustained her business through nine previous loans from NWTF.  

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials like a net, gasoline, bamboo, etc.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Nida requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell such as coffee, milk, noodles and soap.

Nida has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Nida would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as coffee, milk, noodles and soap

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is 39 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. Alona works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell.

Alona has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future Alona would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for an efficient cooking gas package using Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for efficient cooking energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas.

loans.name: Cristo Nos Guia Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal Cristo nos guía está conformado por ocho integrantes, madres solteras con quince hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudieron cursar sus estudios, y se vieron obligados a trabajar desde temprana edad. En la actualidad luchan día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor  a sus hijos.
Gracias a sus esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Martha y  tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, fósforos, detergente, gaseosas, jugos. Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestible, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Cristo nos guía agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan  a personas de escasos  recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal association Cristo nos guía [Christ Guides Us] is made up of eight members, single women with 15 children under their responsibility. They are from Sauce, which is located in the northern part of the region. They describe themselves as hardworking, responsible, and eager for self-improvement. Unfortunately, because of lack of economic resources, they were unable to study and had to work from a young age. Today they strive day to day to provide a better future for their children. 

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, the coordinator is Martha; she has a “pulpería,” which is a small store that sells groceries in small quantities, such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, matches, detergent, soda, and juice. She works in her store 12 hours a day. The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her grocery store, so that she can have a  better income in the not-too-far future. Cristo nos guía is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders provide to people with limited resources and to poor countries such as Nicaragua,  so that they can make a decent living.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her grocery store with products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, matches, detergent, soda, and juice.

loans.name: Claudia Cordelia

texts.es:
Claudia de 59 años de edad, casada con un hijo menor de edad, es originaria de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, se caracterizan por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos. Lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar por falta de recursos económicos. En la actualidad luchan día a día para brindarle un futuro mejor a su hijo.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica, una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, huevos, queso,  crema, jugos, gaseosas, galletas. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Claudia agradece la ayuda  que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Claudia, 59, is married and has a child under the age of 18. She is a native of Leon, a city located in the western part of the country. Claudia describes herself as a hardworking and responsible person keen to better herself. In her free time, she likes to enjoy the company of her children. Unfortunately they were unable to study due to a lack of financial resources. Currently she is fighting every day to give her son a better quality of life.

Thanks to her hard work and her desire to get ahead in life, she runs a grocery store as her form of income. A grocery store is a small store that sells food products in small quantities such as rice, beans, sugar, eggs, cheese, cream, juice, fizzy drinks and biscuits. 

The aim of the loan is to invest in working capital and provide her business in the sale and purchase of food stuffs so that in a not-so-distant future she can have a better income. Claudia is grateful to the Kiva loan lenders for the help that they give to people with few financial resources, and poor countries such as Nicaragua, to have a decent means of working.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and provide the business in the sale and purchase of food products such as rice, beans, sugar, eggs, cheese, cream, juice, fizzy drinks and biscuits.

loans.name: Ma. Socorro

texts.en:
Ma. Socorro is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell cashew nuts business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of cashew nuts to sell. Ma. Socorro has been in this business for 10 years. Ma. Socorro earns additional income from raising pigs.

Ma. Socorro has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of cashew nuts to sell.

loans.name: Leonora

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

Leonora has been in this business for three years.

In the future Leonora would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc

She has been running the general store for nine years and Jhona also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, air-conditioner and fabric.

loans.name: María Lilian

texts.es:
María de 50 años de edad,  no fue a la escuela,  por falta de escuela en la zona y lo otro por el poco interés que le daban los padres de antes al aprendizaje,  se casó a la edad de los dieciocho años, procrearon 5 hijos con su pareja. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, los cinco hijos viven en su casa, tres de ellos estudian y los demás trabajan en casa, nadie aparte del núcleo vive con ella.
 
María aparte de ser ama de casa, también apoya a su hijo y esposo en la agricultura, también tiene un vivero de tilapias las que cuida y luego las vende, del negocio de las tilapias, tiene dos años de haber empezado, en capacitaciones que realizaban en la comunidad acerca de los criaderos de peces fue donde le inicio la idea de poner su propio vivero. Aparte del negocio que generaba de la venta de la cosecha no tenía más actividades.  El vivero lo tiene a unos 100 metros de la casa, no tiene horario de trabajo.   

El crédito lo necesita para la agricultura, lo invertirá en personas que le ayuden a su hijo y esposo, en la preparación de la tierra, el mejoramiento será el ya ir adelantando el trabajo para la época de la siembra, la necesidad satisfecha será el  avanzar desde ya con los trabajos.

Su sueño es, lograr  mantener su familia siempre unida es lo más importante, luego luchar siempre cada día contra todas las adversidades, lo que espera a futuro es heredarles un buen ejemplo de responsabilidad a sus hijos, el préstamo le ayudara en solventar la necesidad antes mencionada.
texts.en:
María, 50, didn’t go to school because there wasn’t one in her area and because her parents had little interest in her education. She got married at 18 and had 5 children.  Her husband is a farmer. Her five children live at home with her, three study and the rest work at house. Apart from her immediate family, no one else lives in her house.

 Besides being a homemaker, María also helps her son and her husband in farming and she has a tilapia hatchery which she raises and later sells. She started her tilapia business 2 years ago; conducting trainings in the community about fish farms was where she had the idea of having her own hatchery. Apart from business generated from the sale of the crop she had no other activities.  She has the hatchery about 100 meters from her house and she doesn’t have a work schedule.   

She needs the loan for farming. She will invest it by hiring help to aid her son and husband, in land preparation. The improvement will help them get ahead for the harvesting season.

Her dream is to have her family always united which is the most important thing later to always strive each day against adversities. What she hopes for the future is to set a good example of responsibility to her children. The loan will help resolve the needs previously mentioned.

loans.use: to pay for hired help to prepare the land for sowing.

loans.name: Iván Darío

texts.es:
Iván se gana la vida como independiente desde hace ya varios años, trabajando en su propio negocio, una tienda de licores en la cual ofrece otros productos como dulces y frituras.
La idea surge luego de la necesidad de aumentar sus ingresos y dedicarle tiempo a su esposa.
Este emprendedor de 51 años trabaja solo y abre su negocio todos los días desde la 1:00 pm hasta altas horas de la noche, en las mañanas se dedica a realizar oficios varios.
Tiene la meta de acreditar su negocio en el sector donde vive y poder aumentar sus ventas para mejorar su la calidad de vida y la de su esposa.
Este carismático hombre sabe que para que el negocio prospere debe ofrecer variedad de productos y buen servicio, por eso está solicitando un préstamo para comprar surtido como golosinas, frituras, nuevos licores y demás bebidas.
Sus ganas de progresar son admirables y su fe en el negocio es infinita.
texts.en:
Iván has been earning a living in his own business for several years. He has a liquor store which sells other products such as sweets and fried food. The idea came later from a need to increase his income and to have time with his wife. This entrepreneur is only 51 years old and he opens his shop every day from 1 pm until early in the morning. In the mornings he does various trades work.

His goal is to provide his business in the area where he lives and to increase his sales, to improve the quality of life for him and his wife.
This charismatic man knows that in order for his business to prosper he has to have a variety of products and good service. That is why he is requesting a loan to purchase stock such as sweets, fried food, new liquors and other beverages.

His desire to progress is admirable and his faith in his shop is infinite.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as sweets, fried food, new liquors and other beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for efficient cooking energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for his son’s education.

loans.name: Elimilet

texts.es:
Elimilet de 36 años de edad, casado con dos hijos menores de edad. Son originarios de Achuapa, lugar que está ubicado en la zona  norte de la región. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad. Para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la comprar y vena de ganada. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. Ya que es una zona rural. El objetivo del crédito es comprar ganado para la venta ya que se lo están ofreciendo a buen precio. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Elimilet agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Elimilet is 36 years old and married with two minor-aged children. They are from Achuapa, located in the north of the region. He is hard-working and responsible with a desire for improvement. In his free time he enjoys the company of his children. Unfortunately he was not able to study towards a degree and was obligated to work from an early age to help with household expenses. On a day-to-day basis he fights to be able to offer his children a better future.

Thanks to his efforts and his desire to get ahead he has work buying and selling cattle. The business is located at his house, since it is a rural area. The objective of the loan is to purchase cattle to sell because they are being offered at a good price, so that he can have a better income in the near future. Elimilet is grateful for the help Kiva investors offer people of limited resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua in order to have a dignified means of work.

loans.use: to invest in work capital and purchase cattle to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Deoghar is the nearest town for Rohani village in Jharkhand. Since there is a lack of proper transportation between these places, lots of auto-rickshaws run to and fro. They mainly help in dropping children at school, as Deoghar has a good number of private schools. Thus there is a great demand for auto-rickshaw drivers. 

Anita (39) is married and the mother of two sons and a daughter who all are studying, while her elder son also works part-time. Her husband owns an auto-rickshaw but it needs to be repaired.  So for now he runs an auto-rickshaw taken on rent from other auto-rickshaw owners and earns 500 INR per day.  Most of his earnings are spent for the maintenance and rent of the auto-rickshaw. The income generated is insufficient to support his family, and the family even does agriculture activities; from this source they earn INR 20,000 per annum. 

Anita wants a loan of INR 8,000 to repair her husband’s auto-rickshaw and hopes this will help her earn more. Anita wants to earn at least enough to she can provide her children with education and facilities to make them capable to stand on their own feet and reach the zenith of success in their lives.

loans.use: to repair their auto-rickshaw

Marites has been in this business for 6 years. Marites would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

texts.en:
Luvisminda works hard to support her family. Luvisminda is married and has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines.

Luvisminda requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Luvisminda has been in this business for 30 years now.

Luvisminda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marites is 42 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Marites has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marites requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients such as meat, fish, spices and vegetables for her food production business.

Marites has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Marites would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as meat, fish, spices and vegetables for her food production business

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Liezel is 41 years old and has three children who are in school.

Liezel has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Liezel requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Liezel has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, Liezel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Fima

texts.en:
Fima works hard to support her family. Fima is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Fima requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients such as meat, spices, vegetables and fish for her food production business.

Fima has been in this business for 13 years now.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Fima would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as meat, spices, vegetables and fish for her food production business

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 57 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines.  Amelita is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Amelita has been in this business for 10 years and she also earns income by running a general store.

Amelita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to build her business.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina works hard to support her family. Divina is married and runs a general store in the Philippines.

Divina requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy goods, like soft-drinks, canned goods, noodles, sugar, fabric conditioner, laundry soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Divina has been in this business for 12 years.

Divina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy goods like soft-drinks, canned goods, noodles, sugar, fabric conditioner, laundry soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
Annalyn is 26 years old and married with two children. 

Annalyn is in the agricultural business, farming coconuts and bananas in the Philippines.  Annalyn requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Annalyn has been farming coconuts and bananas for two years, and has borrowed in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Annalyn would like to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 55 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming coconut in the Philippines. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to purchase additional coconut seedlings, fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Erlinda has been in this business for 30 years and she also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconut seedlings, fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a more efficient cooking gas package from Liquefied Petroleum Gas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for an efficient and clean cooking gas package

loans.name: Chakravorti

texts.en:
Chakravorti is 47 years old and lives in Kelahabad village, Deoghar, Jharkhand. He has been in the paddy processing business for the last 10-12 years. He is also a farmer. He lives with his wife and a son who is in college and 2 daughters who go to school. His son also helps Chakravorti in his business.

Chakravorti is a member of a Self Help Group (SHG) of MESP, a local NGO. He has benefited from the involvement with training and employment opportunities provided to the SHG. 

Now he wants to enlarge his business and increase his monthly income. To fulfill his children’s ambitions and initiate the process of change of having a better standard of living for his family, he needs a loan of INR 20,000.

Chakravorti will be using the loan to purchase a rice hulling machine and paddy. He hopes to save for his son’s education and for their bright future. He wants to generate employment for other villagers by running his business on a large scale.  

He is very thankful to the NGO for their support which is helping him to raise his standard of living and the generous investors who stand up for his cause.

loans.use: to purchase a rice huller machine and paddy

loans.name: Pramila

texts.en:
Pramila, in her fifties, is starting her first loan cycle with the local NGO “MESP”. She is a very diligent woman.

She hails from Rohani village, Deoghar, Jharkhand. She never got an opportunity to go to school and remained illiterate as her family couldn't afford the school fees. 

Pramila was always a smart woman and was able, with a small sum of working capital, to start her own farm which consists of goats and kids. She is married and has three sons; all are construction laborers and earn 400-500 INR per day. Her husband is a painter and earns INR 7,000 per month. 
            
The loan Pramila is requesting will be used to buy three goats. She will acquire the animals in her community, then raise and sell them. The couple don't want to be dependent on their sons for a living so they are saving for their future.

loans.use: to buy goats to raise and later sell

loans.name: Telesfora

texts.en:
Telesfora works hard to support her family. Telesfora is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store. Telesfora has been in this business for 13 years now, and also earns additional income from frozen foods vending.

In the future, Telesfora  would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 31 years old and married with three children.

Eva works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Eva seeks aa loan from NWTF. She has been running the general store for one year and she also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Eva aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a married woman with five children.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Evangeline is 31 years old and has four children who attend school.

Evangeline has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase fish to sell in her stall.

Evangeline has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Imelda works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from food vending. 

Imelda is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her fishing business.

Imelda has sustained her business through her past two loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercidita works hard to support her family. Mercidita is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Mercidita requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.  She has been in this business for 10 years.

Mercidita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 35 years old and married with two children. With two children currently in school, Rosalia works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. Rosalia has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soft-drinks, salt, feeds, etc. 

In the future, Rosalia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Teresa is 46 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Teresa has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a 25,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, soft-drinks, detergent soap, beers, noodles, cooking oil, shampoo, etc. to sell. Teresa has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Teresa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, soft-drinks, detergent soap, beers, noodles, cooking oil, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Nuha

texts.en:
Nuha was born in 1994. She is a widow, living with her only son in a sector in Jordan called Zarqa. 

Nuha has been trying her best to provide for her son's needs by selling clothes.  She has been in business for the past 10 months. 

She finds her work profitable and she is planning to expand it to improve her standards. 

Nuha is seeking a loan to purchase a new collection of clothes in order to attract more customers and raise her profit.

loans.use: to expand the quantity of clothes she sells.

loans.name: Mardilyn

texts.en:
Mardilyn is 39 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines.  Mardilyn is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Mardilyn has been buying and selling livestock for 10 years and she earns additional income by direct selling Avon products.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 44 years old and married with two children.

Rowena works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell to customers.

Rowena has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has run her general store for 10 years and she earns additional income from electronic mobile load retailing.

Rowena aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Damayanti

texts.en:
Damayanti, 41 years old, is married with four sons. Her husband is a physically challenged man; one of his eyes is not functioning, so it’s difficult for him to work. Damayanti is a strong woman with high hopes. She has a lot of responsibilities on her shoulders. 

Rohani village is a remote village in Deoghar district, Jharkhand. Deoghar town has emerged as a dairy hub in recent years, and most of the residents of Rohani started dairy businesses. This village also has a milk chilling plant. 

Since Damayanti is from Rohani, she followed the trend and got into the dairy business with three cows and two calves. Her business is doing well and she wants it to grow, for which she is requesting this loan. She wants to buy one more cow. The risk is minimal, since there is so much demand for milk in this area.

Damayanti keeps her cows and calves in a shed next to her house. One of her sons helps her on her dairy farm. He also sells milk in Deoghar market or to the milk chilling plant, while her other three sons work in Deoghar town. With this loan, she expects to double their sales. 

Damayanti never went to school, but dreams of being a successful dairy entrepreneur. She wants to establish a modern dairy farm.

loans.use: to buy a cow for her dairy farm.

loans.name: Esam

texts.en:
Esam is 21 years old.  He lives in a sector in Jordan called Rsaifeh with his six siblings and parents. 

Esam is studying computer information systems: a diploma degree major. He is in his second year. 

He also works at a restaurant in the evening.  Esam is planning to find a better job after graduation in order to support his family financially. 

Esam requesting a loan to pay for his upcoming school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is 21 years old.  He lives in a rented house with his three siblings and his mother, in Karak-Jordan. His father is deceased. 

Omar is a university student majoring in Tourism Guidance and he is is his second year.  

Because of his sense of responsibility toward his family, Omar is planning to find a good job in his study field after graduation, in order to support his family financially. 

Omar is seeking a loan to pay for his upcoming school fees because he doesn't have enough money to do so.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Muneera

texts.en:
Because Muneera is a conservative woman, she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. Muneera was born in 1968. She is has six sons and daughters. Because of her sense of responsibility toward her family, she has been supporting her husband in running his mini-market for one year. 

Now, she wants to help him in expanding the mini-market by purchasing a refrigerator and a freezer where they can keep drinks and frozen meat, but they don't have enough money to get them. Because of that, Muneera has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and a freezer for her husbands' mini-market.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en: Samar was born in 1966. She is married and has 6 sons and daughters. Her husband works in agriculture. Samar has been running her mini market for one year now, in order to support her husband in improving their standards of living as well as covering their children needs. She is now planning to expand her mini market business by purchasing new food products, in order to cover her customers needs and to attract more customers to raise her profits. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. Because of that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of food products

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.es: Vanessa de 29 años de edad habita con sus pequeños hijos en las edades de 1 y 5 años al sur de la ciudad, donde se dedica a la actividad comercial, dese el año 2011 cuando emprendió un negocio de venta de papelería, ropa, y artículos varios tipo miscelánea. Su negocio nace por la necesidad de atender a sus dos pequeños y generar ingresos al mismo tiempo sin perderlos de vista, para que se eduquen muy bien y sobre todo se encuentren protegidos. Inicialmente inició con un crédito para surtirlo de mercancías, que usualmente pidieron sus clientes, al principio vendía cremas y cosméticos, pero el mercado empezó a impulsar su necesidad de incluir y diversificar su oferta y fue agregando otros productos, como detalles para fiestas, perfumería ropa etc.  Sus ventas las realiza de contado en su punto comercial, desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9:30 de la noche, porque su meta de crecimiento no se detiene, para finalmente lograr con sus utilidades adquirir su propia casa. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa infantil y ropa femenina para adultos, cremas, productos capilares y una vitrina para hacer su mejor exhibición e impacta a sus clientes desde el punto de venta, lo cual haría de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Vanessa at 29 years old lives with her two small children, aged 1 and 5 in the south of the city. She has been in business since 2011 when she started selling stationary, clothing and other miscellaneous products. Her business grew out of the necessity to support her young ones, generating income while not losing sight of them. She wants to educate them and and moreover know that they are protected.

She started with a loan to buy stock that her customers usually asked for. At the beginning she sold creams and cosmetics but the market began to lead her to including and diversifying her offerings and she added more items such as things for parties, perfume, clothing, etc. She sells on credit. Her working day is from 7 in the morning until 9:30 at night as her goal of growing never stops. In the end she would like to buy a house with her profits.  

For these reasons she has requested a loan from Kiva, the first loan she has had through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will buy clothing for children and women, cream, hair products and a display case to highlight her products better and visually attract her clients. This will make it a successful loan from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy clothing for women and children, creams, hair products and a display case.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Ever since she was a young girl, Julia loved to cut and style hair. She would constantly re-style her dolls’ hair and even cut her sister’s and dog’s hair when her mom wasn’t looking! Today, Julia has been doing hair professionally for 15 years. She started out with ULTA, a corporate salon, to receive certification and to enable her to teach others. Since then, Julia has worked in many different salons.

Every time Julia relocates, her loyal clientele follow her. When she noticed this trend, she realized that she had a loyal following of over 170 clients who believed in her and trusted her. This was the key moment that inspired Julia to start her own salon. 

Julia will start with two other stylists who will rent chairs in her salon. She also hopes to reach out to beauty schools to find an intern to be her receptionist and hopes to teach other stylists to be better at what they do. Julia wants her business to be different, changing the image of the boutique salon from an expensive and exclusive niche to a place where families can receive affordable quality service.

Julia loves what she does, because she enjoys building relationships with people, while also making them feel good about themselves. Working on hair is like an art for Julia; it helps her to express her creativity and feel free. 

As a single mom with one son, it has been difficult for Julia to save enough money to start her own business. She doesn’t want to ask her family for money because she is determined to do this on her own. Julia will use her $10,000 Kiva loan to purchase equipment and inventory for her start-up, as well as to market her services. 

Julia has always believed in herself and is determined to find more ways to do what she loves, living by her life’s motto, “keep strong, keep going, and never give up.”

loans.use: to purchase equipment and inventory for her start-up, as well as to market her services.

loans.name: Noura

texts.en: Noura was born in 1972. She is a married woman and a mother of 4. Noura has been selling blankets and clothes for 3 years now at her own store. Her store is the second provider for her family's living expenses and she is planning to expand her business to raise her income. Now she is seeking a loan to purchase a new collection of clothes and blankets.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of blankets and clothes

loans.name: Manal

texts.en: Manal was born in 1973. She is a married woman living in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Zarqa. Her husband is a contractor. Manal has been supporting her husband by selling blankets, clothes and houseware for the past 5 years at her house. She is planning to open her own store in the future to raise her profits. Now she is seeking a loan to purchase a new collection of products in order to raise her income and to attract more customers. But she does not have enough money to do so. Because of that, Zarqa has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase more houseware, clothes and blankets for her business

loans.name: Eman

texts.en: Eman was born in 1967. She is a divorced woman living in Irbid-Jordan. Eman has been working hard in covering her needs by selling detergent for the past 1 year. She started her business selling a small amount of detergent to her neighbors and friends. Now she is planning to expand her business by purchasing a larger quantity of materials which she needs to make more detergent. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. Because of that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of materials for making detergents

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud was born in 1954. He is a father of six sons and three daughters. In order to support his big family after retirement, he opened a small kiosk selling hot drinks that is working out very well. Mahmoud has requested this loan to purchase a greater variety of hot drinks and herbs to serve.

loans.use: to purchase more hot drinks and herbs.

loans.name: Sebastián De Jesús

texts.es:
Sebastián de 42 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, se casó a la edad de los veinte y cinco  años, a procreo tres  hijos con su pareja, quien es ama de casa y también es empleada como vigilante en un hospital, es gente muy humilde y trabajadora,  ella es la que se encarga de las labores del hogar, tiene gallinas y cerdos los que en gorda para posteriormente venderlos, esto lo hace con la ayuda de sus hijos, dos de los tres hijos estudian. En la casa viven los suegros de Sebastián.


Él es vigilante de un hotel en la ciudad y también se dedica a la  agricultura, tiene más de veinte años de ser agricultor y 6 de ser empleado, su padre desde pequeño le enseño que la vida solo se vivía bien, si trabajaba honradamente, no tiene más actividades a las que se dedique, donde trabaja como seguridad, la distancia que recorre es de 40 km, realiza turnos de 48 horas continuas. Por lo que, el resto del tiempo lo dedica a la agricultura.

El préstamo será invertido en la agricultura, lo utilizara en empezar a preparar la tierra para esta época de siembra, el mejoramiento será el poder estar desde ya ir preparando para la siembra de granos básicos, que son el consumo primordial en la zona, la necesidad satisfecha será el tener su propio capital de trabajo y no andar buscando prestado a un particular.

Su sueño, es que sus hijos se preparen en la educación y  poderlos sacar adelante por medio del sacrificio  que incurre tener hijos estudiando, espera que sus hijos se preparen para que no tengan que vivir con la pobreza que él vivió, de lo que gana como empleado va ir pagando la cuota mensual, por lo que al final la ganancia de la venta de la coseche serán en su totalidad libres para invertir en otros proyectos.
texts.en:
Sebastián is 42 years old and studied until Grade 4. He got married when he was 25 and has 3 children with his partner who is a housewife and also works as a guard in a hospital. They are modest and hard-working people. She takes care of the work in the house and has chickens and pigs which she raises and sells. She has the help of her children to do this. Two out of the three children attend school.Sebastián's in-laws also live in the house.

Sebastián is a security guard in a hotel in the city and also is a farmer. He has been a farmer for 20 years and has 6 years working as an employee. His father taught him that you had to live life well and to work honorably. The place where he works is 40 km away and he works 48 hour shifts.The rest of the time he farms. 

The loan will be invested in agriculture. He will use it to start preparing the land for planting. The improvement will be that he will start right now to plant his basic grains which are the fundamental crops of the area. He needs working capital and he doesn't want to get it from just any person. His dream is for his children to get an education and be able to get them ahead with the sacrifice needed to have children in school. He hopes that his children will have education and not have to live with the poverty that he has seen. What he earns from his employment will pay the installments of his loan so that in the end, the profits from the sale of his crops will be completely free to invest in other projects.

loans.use: to prepare his fields for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a cooking gas package with an energy-efficient cookstove.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the most efficient and affordable cooking gas package.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a more efficient cooking energy package.

loans.name: Isaí Moisés

texts.es:
Isaí de 24 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno  grado, por la situación económica  no pudo seguir estudiando, se vio obligado a tomar acción  propia a dedicarse a la venta de pan, con lo que hoy le sirve para mantener a su familia. Su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, está embarazada, por lo que no puede realizar una actividad muy fuerte, tienen un hijo de tres años quien no asiste aun a la escuela. Junto a ellos viven los papas de Isaí, pero que también ellos tienen sus propios ingresos. 
 

Él vende pan dulce y francés, le vende a una panadería que le da el 30% de la venta total como su sueldo, ya tiene un año de realizar la actividad, la necesidad de ingresos económicos  al núcleo, lo llevo a emprender este negocio, no tiene más actividades a la que se dedique, la distancia que recorre diario es de unos 20 kilómetros, ya que vende por todos los caseríos vecinos, el recorrido lo hace en su motocicleta, solo él se dedica a la actividad, tiene un horario de trabajo de 1:00 pm y 7:00 pm.


El préstamo será utilizado para el pago de una deuda que adquirió cuando compro la motocicleta, el mejoramiento será el poder salir más rápido del compromiso crediticio, ya que donde estaba solo está pagando intereses y nada que baja el capital, la necesidad satisfecha será poder salir en menos tiempo en el pago de su compromiso crediticio. 

Espera ir poco a poco ir creciendo las ventas y la clientela, irse preparando desde ya económicamente para cuando  su primer hijo empiece la escuela, tener una estabilidad para él y los suyos. Las ganancias serán dirigidas  un porcentaje al pago de la cuota y lo demás a la  inversión  en la casa y el ahorro.
texts.en:
Isaí, age 24, studied through the ninth grade.  Due to his financial situation, he couldn’t keep attending school.  He found himself needing to take action, and he found a job selling bread—a job which serves to support his family today.  His wife is a homemaker.  She is pregnant, so she cannot do hard work.  They have a three-year-old who isn’t in school yet.  Isaí’s parents live with them, but they have their own income.

He sells French bread and sweet rolls.  His nuclear family’s need for income is what brought him to begin this business.  He sells the bread to a shop that gives him 30% of the sales as his salary.  He has been doing this for a year; he doesn’t have any additional jobs.  He travels 20 kilometers daily, because he sells throughout all the neighboring villages.  He makes the trip on his motorcycle, working a schedule from 1 p.m. until 7 p.m.

The loan will be used to make payment on a debt that he got when he bought his motorcycle.  It will be an improvement to be able to get out from under the debt more quickly, because he had been paying only the interest, with nothing on the capital; he will be able to complete his loan payments earlier.

Little by little he hopes to increase his sales and customer base.  He is already getting ready for when his first child will begin school, to give him stability.  A percentage of his earnings will be used for the loan payments and the rest will be invested in his home and savings.

loans.use: to make payment on a debt that he acquired when he bought his motorcycle.

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es: Jacinto tiene 63 años, está casado con Zenobia y tiene el orgullo de tener a sus dos hijos ya mayores e independientes. Vive junto a su esposa en su casa hecha a base de material noble. Jacinto se dedica a la agricultura que desempeña hace mas de 40 años por herencia de sus padres quienes le enseñaron a trabajar en la producción de los distintos cultivos rentables como el cacao, café y otros árboles frutales. Tiene la suerte de contar con su esposa quien desde siempre fue su principal apoyo. Acostumbra realizar sus labores complicadas como el retiro de maleza y cosecha con el apoyo de trabajadores para culminar estas tareas en menor tiempo. Una de las complicaciones que tiene en su negocio es la distancia de sus terrenos hasta los centros de venta en la capital de su localidad. Es el segundo préstamo que solicita a su entidad financiera y agradece por la oportunidad que le brindan. Desea en esta ocasión contar con 3,500 nuevos soles para invertirlos en sus terrenos con la compra de abono orgánico al por mayor y herramientas de trabajo.
texts.en:
Jacinto is 63 years old.  He is married to Zenobia and takes pride in having two children who are already grown-up and living on their own.  He lives together with his wife in their house built with sturdy materials.  

Jacinto works in agriculture.  He has been carrying out this type of job for more than 40 years, as an inheritance from his parents, who taught him to work raising different profitable crops such as cacao, coffee, and fruit trees.  He is lucky in being able to count on his wife, who has always been his main support.  He usually does his more complicated jobs, such as weeding and sowing, with the help of workers in order to finish those jobs in less time.  One of the complications that he has in his work is the distance from his land to the sales centers in the capital city of his region.  

This is the second loan that he has taken out from his financial institution, and he is thankful for the opportunity they have given him.  This time he wants 3,500 nuevos soles to invest in his plots of land through the purchase of work tools and organic fertilizer in bulk.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and tools

loans.name: Lucero Yesabel

texts.es:
Lucero tiene 22 años y es la cuarta de nueve hermanos, vive con su madre, ama de casa, y su padre que es taxista. Ambos no cuentan con estudios superiores y desean, para su hija, la oportunidad que ellos no tuvieron de ser profesionales. Lucero trabajaba en una tienda de productos naturales por las tardes y con dicho ingreso pagaba inicialmente sus estudios, sin embargo el numero de horas de clase ha aumentado y ha tenido que dejar de laborar al no tener tiempo disponible para estudiar; tiene 3 hermanos menores y sus padres no pueden ayudarla económicamente por lo que no podría seguir estudiando sin el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva.
Su sueño es poder ser profesional y trabajar en una empresa textil para combinar y crear soluciones en teñido y así poder ayudar a su familia y a su hermana menor económicamente para que también pueda tener una carrera profesional.
Ella agradece profundamente la ayuda que los prestamistas de Kiva brindan a estudiantes como ella y piensa que la educación es algo que hace crecer a la gente como persona y que los conocimientos que adquieran pueden ser transmitidos e influenciar positivamente en su entorno.
texts.en:
Lucero, age 22, is the fourth of nine siblings.  She lives with her mother, a housewife, and her father, a taxi driver.  Neither of her parents has a higher education, and they wish for their daughter to have the opportunity that they did not have to become a professional. 

In the afternoons Lucero worked at a natural products store.  With this income she made her initial payment for her studies.  However, the number of class hours has increased, and she has had to stop work because she did not have the time available to study.  She has three younger siblings, and her parents are not able to help her financially.  Therefore, she would not be able to continue studying without the help of the Kiva lenders.

Her dream is to be able to be a professional and to work at a textile company.  She wants to do this in order to combine and create dying solutions.  This way she will be able to help her family and her younger sister financially so that she will also be able to have a professional career.

She is profoundly grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders give to students like her.  She thinks that education is something that makes you grow as a person.  The knowledge that you acquire can be transmitted and positively influence the environment.

loans.use: to pay for her studies in textile chemistry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a more efficient cooking gas package of liquefied petroleum gas.

loans.name: Tahani

texts.en: Tahani was born in 1990. She is a married lady and a mother of 2. Because of Tahani's sense of responsibility toward her family, she started selling snacks and candy. She found her business profitable and she has made it a source of income for her family. Tahani is now requesting a youth loan to purchase more snacks and candy to sell in order to raise her income and to help support for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more snacks and candy

loans.name: Marlin Adali

texts.es:
Marlin de 25 años de edad, solo estudio hasta 7º grado, ella es madre soltera sus dos hijos viven con ella,un hijo estudia 1º grado y el otro pasa en casa.


El negocio de ella es venta de tamales pisques,el cual los hace por encargo toda su familia se dedica a este negocio,su hermana le ayuda a vender casa por casa.



El préstamo lo utilizara para vender cenas típicas por las tardes, a parte del negocio de tamales,  de esa forma lograra salir adelante para crecer a sus hijos.

El objetivo de la cliente es siempre mantener su negocio y de esa forma siempre tendrán lo mas importante para sus hijos y quiere trabajar siempre con la  institución.
texts.en:
Marlin, 25 years old, only studied as far as the seventh grade. She is a single mother and her two children live with her. One is in first grade and the other is at home.

Her business is selling traditional tamales made to order. Her whole family works at this business. Her sister helps her sell door-to-door.

She will use the loan to sell traditional dinners in the evenings, separate from the tamale business, so she can manage to get ahead to raise her children.

Her goal is always to maintain her business so they always have what is most important for the children. She wants to continue working with the institution every time.

loans.use: to sell traditional dinners in the evenings.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large number of spare-parts to add to his current stock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more meat to meet his customer's demand.

loans.name: Kisiwani Group

texts.en: Christina, who is in her early 40s, is married and has three children who are still in school. She has been running a retail shop since 1999. She works from 6 to 10pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. This will be Christina’s tenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the shop’s inventory, and now the shop is really big. She is happy with the loan. She used the profits to pay school fees and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan for a further increase in the shop inventory. She dreams of building her own house. Christina will share this loan with her loan group, “Kisiwani,” which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to further increase her shop inventory.

loans.name: Liliana Alexandra

texts.es: Liliana una joven de 19 años que estudia la carrera de Idiomas como el francés e Ingles. Decidió estudiar dicha carrera  al ver que era su vocación, pues desde muy joven siempre le interesó conocer nuevas culturas. Actualmente apoya a sus padres en el hogar. Agradece a  su madre, pues es ella quien le brinda su apoyo. El crédito que solicitó lo destinará para el pago de sus pensiones de estudio. El deseo de Liliana es de terminar satisfactoriamente su carrera y ser competitiva en su especialidad. Agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por apoyar  a jóvenes como ella.
texts.en: Liliana is a young woman who is studying languages (French and English). She decided to study these subjects because she has a gift for them and she had been interested in learning about different cultures since she was a little girl. She currently helps her parents in their home. She is grateful to her mother because she supports her. She will use the loan she applied for to pay her study fees. Liliana's ambition is to complete her course successfully and be competitive in her field. She is grateful to Kiva investors for the help they give to young people like her.

loans.use: to pay her study fees.

loans.name: Rania

texts.en: Because Rania is a conservative woman, she asked her husband to stand in for her in the picture. Rania was born in 1975. She is the mother of five sons and one daughter. Rania has been designing business cards and cards for special occasions for four years. After her neighbors and friends recognized her talent, they gave her the idea of selling them. She found her business profitable and created a workshop for it in a room at her house. Now she is applying for a loan to buy the materials she need to make more occasion cards and increase her productivity and her profits.

loans.use: to buy the needed material to make and sell more cards for special occasions

loans.name: Lorenzo Rafael

texts.es:
El olor a madera y a barniz se siente al entrar a la casa de Rafael. En su patio, se puede observar algunas piezas completamente elaboradas con acabados bien finos.  Además de la venta de madera, también ofrece gaseosas al público que lo visita.  Desde hace seis años se dedica a este negocio, logrando conseguir buenos clientes, debido a la calidad de sus productos.
Sin embargo, su sueño es que sus piezas sean comercializadas en el extranjero ya que existe un buen mercado para este tipo de negocio. Gracias a un préstamo de Mi Crédito y KIVA, logrará comprar la cantidad suficiente  de materiales para conseguir un mayor volumen de ventas.  Solicita el crédito para comprar: Barniz y Madera. Las ganancias serán para beneficio de sus hijos  y del establecimiento.
texts.en:
The smell of wood and varnish is sensed upon entering Rafael's house. Completed and assembled pieces with very smooth finishes can be seen on his patio. In addition to selling wood, he also offers soft drinks to members of the public that visit him. He has worked in this business for six years, managing to establish a good customer base due to the quality of his products.

However, his dream is for his pieces be sold internationally because there is a good market for this type of business. Thanks to a loan from Mi Crédito and Kiva, he will be able to buy enough materials to reach a higher volume of sales. He is requesting the loan to purchase varnish and wood. The earnings will benefit his children and the establishment.

loans.use: to buy varnish and wood.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Emily works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Emily is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell in her fruit stand for her fruit vending business.

Emily has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her fruit stand

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy spare parts to sell to his motor-bike repair customers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy materials such as planks, nails, etc. to make furniture for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy over-the-counter drugs to sell.

loans.name: Tupendane C Group

texts.en: Mwanahamis, who is in her late 30s, is married and has five children, who are still in school. She has been running two projects, selling fruit and vegetables (genge) and selling snacks, such as vitumbuwa, mandazi, chapatti and kalimati. She has been in this business for eight years. She works from 8 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. This will be Mwanahamis’s fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy various types of fruits and vegetables, a sack of baking flour, and some cooking oil and some sugar to use in making snacks. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva’s support of their group, which has brought laughter to the whole group. She used the profit to pay school fees and to buy a TV set, a fridge, a radio, a bed, a cupboard and a sofa set, and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to restock business items. She dreams of buying a plot of land and, later on, building her own house. Mwanahamis will share this loan with her loan group, “Tupendane c,” which has a total of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock items for her food business.

loans.name: Gabriella

texts.fr: Gabriella jeune femme de 31ans a pour mari un entrepreneur et mère de 02 enfants(07 et 02ans). Un seul est scolarisé. Pour contribuer aux besoins de la famille, elle revend depuis 2005 des produits d'alimentation générale dans sa boutique. Ayant de nombreux clients et ne voulant pas les décevoir, elle fait son quatrième crédit à WAGES pour acheter plus de marchandises(riz, sucre, détergents...). Elle espère à l'avenir avoir un grand local afin de vendre en gros et assurer l'avenir de la famille.
texts.en: Gabriella, a young woman, 31 years old, has a husband who is an entrepreneur. And she is a mother of two children (7 and 2 years old). One of the children is in school. To help meet family needs, Gabriella has been selling grocery items in her shop since 2005. With many customers and not wanting to disappoint them, she is taking out her fourth WAGES loan to purchase more merchandise (rice, sugar, detergents, ….) For the future, she hopes to have a big spot for selling in bulk and for ensuring her family’s future.

loans.use: to buy general food products.

loans.name: Dulce

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of seven children, Dulce works hard to support her family. She has an Avon products direct sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Dulce is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of Avon products to sell.

Dulce has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of Avon products to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena, 54 years old, is married and has five children, one child still in school. Elena works very hard to provide for her family.

For the past 20 years, Elena has run a general store in the Philippines. selling a variety of items such as rice, snack foods, beer, soft drinks, noodles, sanitary napkins, etc. She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of these items to sell. Elena would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock such as rice, snack foods, beer, soft drinks, noodles, sanitary napkins, etc. to sell

loans.name: Les Chérubins Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Kakuru est une brave commerçante depuis 9 ans et membre d’un groupe d’Affaires «Les Chérubins» âgée de 33 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants, qui tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse du carburant. Elle installe sa marchandise aux  croisées des avenues animées de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir pour acheter 125 litres d'essence. Son conjoint est un Ingénieur. Elle avait reçu son premier fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son activité, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, en leur accordant de crédit sans garantie matérielle. Il sied de signaler, qu’une cliente à mains porte son bébé.
texts.en:
This client, Kakuru, has been a good and honest merchant for nine years and is a member of a business group called “Les Chérubins”. She is 33 years old, married, and the mother of three children, who are all in school. She sets up her merchandise where the avenues cross, a busy part of town.

She is requesting a loan from Hekima to grow her enterprise. This new loan will be used to purchase 125 liters of gasoline. Her husband is an engineer. She had received her starting funds from her husband. For the future, she would like to increase her business and provide education and food for her children. 

She thanks Hekima for its support of unbanked women entrepreneurs by granting them loans without the need for collateral. It should be noted that a client in the photo is holding her child.

loans.use: to purchase 125 liters of gasoline

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en: Antonieta is married and she works hard to support her family.  For the past 15 years, she has operated a fish vending business in the Philippines. Antonieta has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers. Antonieta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Aura Luz

texts.es:
Aura es una mujer de desafíos y trabajo duro, hace 12 años trabaja en una bodega en la cual presta el servicio de guardado de carretas, chazas de venta, motocicletas, bicicletas y demás vehículos y herramientas que pueda tener en su bodega, este servicio lo combina con la venta de helados, bebidas, frituras, golosinas, entre otros, es decir, es una mujer aguerrida que desea progresar.
Pero esto no es un trabajo fácil, pues todos los días abre su negocio desde las 4:00 am hasta altas horas de la noche y además el negocio le demanda su presencia constante, aunque eventualmente uno de sus hijos le ayuda en el negocio, ella prefiere estar enterada de todo lo que pase con respecto a él.
Su mayor anhelo es poder ayudar a sus dos hijos a salir adelante, además, ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida.
En estos momentos Aura necesita recursos económicos para surtir su negocio con bebidas, helados y golosinas pues le encanta ver sus enfriadores y estanterías con gran cantidad y variedad de productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes.
texts.en: Aura is not afraid of challenges or hard work. She has worked in a storeroom for 12 years, guarding carts, mobile stalls, motorbikes, bicycles and other vehicles and tools.
