She complements this service by selling ice-creams, drinks, fried foods and sweets, among other things, and so she is clearly a fighter who is determined to succeed. But the work is not easy - her shop is open daily from 4am until late at night and she needs to be there all the time. One of her two children helps her in the shop when required but she prefers to know exactly what is going on. Her big ambition is to be able to help her children to get on in life and provide a better quality of life for them. At present, Aura needs financial resources to enable her to stock her shop with drinks, ice-creams and sweets because she loves to see her coolers and shelves full of a range of high quality goods to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to stock her shop with drinks, ice-creams and sweets

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy materials such as iron corrugated sheets, nails, cement, etc. to construct a house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay school fees and buy building materials for a house.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara, 60 years old, is married and has nine children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 25 years, Clara has run a general store in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Clara has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store to further build her business. Clara has previously borrowed and successfully repaid 4 loans from NWTF. Clara aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a married woman who is 47 years old. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Corazon has four children who are in school.

Corazon has a beauty salon business in the Philippines. Corazon has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her beauty salon business.

Corazon has been in this business for three years. In the future, Corazon would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Fedila

texts.en:
Fedila is 57 years old and married with two children. Fedila works very hard to provide for her family.

Fedila runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Fedila has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as feed, rice, canned goods, soft drinks, detergent soap, shampoo, cereals, etc. 

Fedila would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is a married woman who is 47 years old. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Felipa has three children who are currently in school.

Felipa has a business selling bananas in the Philippines. Felipa has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell.

Felipa has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Felipa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida, 50 years old, is married and has two children, one of them still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

For the past 5 years, Florida has run a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store. In the future, Florida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jasmine

texts.en: Jasmine is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 5 years, she has operated an ice cream vending business in the Philippines. Jasmine has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her ice cream production. Jasmine would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her ice cream production business

loans.name: Andres Del Carmen

texts.es:
Andrés es un pequeño productor de café que vive en la zona norte de Nicaragua, junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos. Desde pequeño ha trabajado en la caficultura, y desde hace diez años cuenta con su propia finca en la cual tiene 5 hectáreas de café en producción. En los últimos tres años este productor ha generado 2 empleos en su comunidad, y ha logrado un promedio de 160 quintales de café pergamino por ciclo. 

El principal desafío para este pequeño productor son las plagas y enfermedades que afectan el café, las cuales está seguro logrará controlar con el adecuado manejo de sus plantaciones. Para esto, Andrés está solicitando un crédito que le permita garantizar los insumos y la mano de obra necesaria para el mantenimiento de su café, y asegurar de esta forma una buena cosecha para el ciclo 2014-2015.

La meta de este productor es incrementar su área de café en un mediano plazo, ya que está seguro que el café es un rubro rentable, de otra forma, afirma que, el café no sería uno de los principales rubros que genera divisas al país.
texts.en:
Andrés is a small coffee producer who lives in northern Nicaragua with his wife and four children. He has worked in the coffee industry since childhood, and for ten years has had his own 5-acre coffee farm. In the last three years, Andrés has generated two jobs in his community, and achieved an average of 160 pounds of parchment coffee per cycle.

The main challenges for Andrés are pests and diseases, which he is sure will affect the maintenance of his crop. Because of this, Andrew is requesting a loan to buy supplies and pay for labor costs for the maintenance of his coffee, and thus ensure a good harvest for the 2014-2015 cycle.

The goal of Andrés is to increase his coffee area in the short term, as he is sure that coffee is a profitable item that generates currency for the country.

loans.use: to buy supplies and pay labor costs for the maintenance of coffee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for an affordable and efficient liquefied petroleum gas cooking energy package.

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maritza de 37 años de edad,  estudio hasta sexto grado, está casada, su pareja trabaja en la agricultura, tienen dos hijos los cuales viven con ellos, la mayor va a la escuela estudia su tercer grado, nadie más vive con ellos, por lo que solo sus dos hijos depende de sus ingresos. 


Ella tiene una granjita de pollos, los que engorda para luego venderlos, ya tiene tres años de realizar esta actividad, la necesidad la llevo a iniciar una fuente de ingreso extra, por lo que decidió instalar algo en lo que podía realizar sin mayor dificultad, como una fuente de ingresos extra, no tiene otra actividad a la que se dedique, el negocio está ubicado en las afueras de la casa, por lo que no recorre distancias alguna, nadie más se involucra en la actividad, el horario de atención es de 6 am a 5 pm. 


El préstamo será invertido en la ampliación del negocio, también comprara más pollos para el engorde, por lo que con el préstamo ya no andara  prestando dinero a particulares para seguir su negocio.


Los sueños que tiene es poder crecer siempre en las ventas y con eso tener mejores ingresos, con lo que se dara a conocer con su comercio cada vez más, el préstamo le ayudara en satisfacer la necesidad que tiene de invertir capital de trabajo, las ganancias de esto serán invertidas en el pago de la cuota y en el cuido a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Martiza, age 37, studied through the sixth grade.  She is married; her husband works in agriculture.  She has two children who live with them.  The older one is a student in the third grade.  No one else lives with them, so their only dependents are their two children.

She has a little farm of chickens, which she fattens to later sell.  She has been doing this for three years now.  She had a need to create an extra source of income, so she decided to do something that wouldn’t be too difficult.  She doesn’t have any other job.  The business is located outside her home, so she doesn’t have to travel any distance.  No one else is involved in the business.  Her schedule is from 6 a.m. until 5 p.m.

This loan will be invested in increasing her business.  She will also buy more chickens to fatten.  So, with this loan, she won’t go on borrowing money from private sources to keep her business going.

Her dream is to be able to always keep expanding her sales, and in that way to have a better income with which she can make her business more and more well-known.  The loan will help her to meet the need that she has for working capital.  She will use her earnings to make her payments and to care for her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy chickens to expand her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric and to renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's school expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a more efficient and affordable cooking gas package.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a cooking gas package, which will enable her to prepare school lessons, and so her children could eat warm food before retiring to bed.

loans.name: Sope Fatou Bintou Rassoul Group

texts.fr: Le groupement SOPE FATOU BINTOU RASSOUL a comme présidente  Fatoumata. Elle est composé de 10 personnes et habitent toutes dans le même village  et se réunissent à chaque fois de besoins.  Fatoumata se reconnait sur la photo par la main levée. Elle est âgée de 33ans, mariée et mère de famille.  Elle n’a aucunes charges particulières et  pratique le maraichage. Elle demande ce crédit pour acheter des semences et intrants et  cultiver de l’oignon et de l’aubergine. Seynabou a une expérience de 2ans. Elle démarre sa journée à  9h pour la finir à 16h. A l’avenir elle souhaite cultiver la tomate pour diversifier ses cultures et augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: The SOPE FATOU BINTOU RASSOUL group has Fatoumata as their president. It is made up of 10 people, who all live in the same village and come together out of need. Fatoumata is raising her hand in the photo. She is a 33-year-old married mother. She has no particular expenses and practices truck farming. She seeks this loan to buy grains and resources and grows onions and eggplant. Seynabou has 2 years of experience. She starts her day at 9am and finishes at 4pm. In the future, she hopes to grow tomatoes to diversify her crops and to increase her earnings and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy grains and resources for truck farming

loans.name: Sope Galass Bou Bene Group

texts.fr: SOPE GALASS BOU BENE est un groupement de promotion féminin qui regroupent 10 femmes  qui habitent toutes dans le  même village et se réunissent à chaque fois de besoin. Elles font la même activité qui est le maraichage. Et a comme présidente Madame Oumou qui  est mariée et mère de famille. On l’a reconnait sur la photo par la main levé. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10ans. Elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter des semences et intrants et pratiquer la culture de ses choux, de l’oignon et aubergine.  Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 17h. Elle souhaite à l’avenir augmenter ses revenus et épargner  de l’argent. Ainsi elle pourra diversifier ses cultures et atteindre d’autres surfaces et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Sope Galass Bou Bene is a women's promotion group counting ten women; they all live in the same village and meet up whenever necessary. They are in the same business, which is growing fruits and vegetables.

Their president is Mrs. Oumou, who is married and has children. You can recognize her in the picture thanks to her raised hand. She helps out her husband with the family's daily expenses. She has over ten years of experience.

She is requesting this amount to purchase seeds and fertilizer to grow cabbage, onions, and eggplants. She starts her day at 8 a.m. and ends at 5 p.m. She would like to increase her revenues in the future and to create some savings. Thus, she will be able to diversify what she grow and to cultivate more parcels, ultimately improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for growing produce.

loans.name: Mbotaye Group

texts.fr: Le groupement Mbotaye  est un  groupement de promotion féminin qui regroupe 7 femmes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier. Elles évoluent dans le commerce de produit divers et denrées alimentaires. Leur présidente s’appelle Aïssatou, elle est mariée et mère de famille qui s’active dans la commercialisation des denrées alimentaires comme le riz, le sucre, l’huile et le savon. Elle a 3ans d’expérience et aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la finir  à 18h. Aïssatou est celle qui n’a pas porté d’enfant sur son dos sur la photo. Elle souhaite avoir des boutiques de denrées alimentaires et augmenter ses revenus afin de pouvoir améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: The Mbotaye group is a group promoting women which is made up of 7 women who all live in the same district. They sells various products including food. Their leader is called Aïssatou. She is married and a mother and sells food products like rice, sugar, oil, and soap. She has 3 years worth of experience with this business and supports her husband with the daily expenses and their children's education expenses. She starts her workday at 8 am and finishes at 6 pm. Aïssatou is the one in the picture who is not carrying a child on her back. She would like to own some grocery shops and to increase her income so that she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy products including rice, sugar, oil, and soap for resale.

loans.name: Sope Khal Ndiol Maure Group

texts.fr: SOPE KHAL NDIOL MAURE est un groupement de promotion féminin qui est composé de 10 femmes qui habitent toutes dans le même village et qui font la même activité. La présidente s’appelle Moulahite, c’est elle qui a levé la main sur la photo. Elle est mariée et mère de famille et est âgée de 66ans. Elle évolue dans le maraichage et a une expérience de plus de 8ans dans cette activité. Elle demande ce montant pour acheter des semences et intrants pour la culture des oignons, aubergine et choux. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle commence sa  journée à 9h pour la terminer à 19h. Elle veut diversifier ses activités et cultiver d’autres surfaces  et cela avec l’aide de l’institution. Elle voudrait augmenter ses revenus et épargner de l’argent à coter et investir encore plus.
texts.en: SOPE KHAL NDIOL MAURE is a group made up of 10 women who all live in the same village and who are in the same business. The president’s name is Moulahite, who is raising her hand in the photo. She is a married mother and is 66 years old. She has been making progress in truck farming and has 8 years of experience in it. She seeks this amount to buy grains and resources to grow onions, eggplant, and cabbage. She helps her husband in managing daily expenses and to pay for schooling for her children. She starts her day at 9am and finishes at 7pm. She wants to diversify her business and cultivate other land with the help of the institution. She would like to augment her earnings and save month and invest more.

loans.use: to buy grains and resources for truck farming

loans.name: Sope Naby Ndiol Group

texts.fr: SOPE NABY NDIOL est un groupement de promotion féminin qui est composé de 10 femmes qui habitent toutes dans le même village et pratiquent les mêmes activités. La présidente s’appelle AYA , c’est une femme âgée de  44ans et elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle pratique l’agriculture et a une expérience de 4ans dans cette activité. Elle n’a pas de charges particulières et commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 19h. Elle demande ce montant pour acheter des semences et des intrants pour pratiquer son maraichage. A l’avenir elle souhaite augmenter ses revenus et épargner de l’argent et cela grâce à l’aide de l’institution. Elle voudrait aussi améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et augmenter ses surfaces cultivables.
texts.en: SOPE NABY NDIOL is a group made up of 10 women who all live in the same village and who are in the same business. The president’s name is Aya, who is a 44-year-old married mother. She is in agriculture and has 4 years of experience in it. She has no particular expenses and starts her day at 9am and finishes at 7pm. She seeks this amount to buy grains and resources for truck farming. In the future, she hopes to augment her earnings and save money thanks to the help of the institution. She also would like to improve her family’s living conditions and the grow her farmable land.

loans.use: to buy grains and resources for truck farming

loans.name: And Book Diom Bou Ndiol Group

texts.fr: Le groupement AND BOOK DIOM BOU NDIOL est composé de 10 personnes. Elles habitent toutes dans le même village et se réunissent à chaque fois de besoin. Leur présidente s’appelle Sokhna qui est âgée de 37ans, on la reconnait sur la photo par la main levée.  Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle évolue dans l’agriculture et demande ce montant pour acheter des semences et des intrants pour pratiquer son activité. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10ans dans cette activité. Elle cultive le chou, riz, oignon et aubergine. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité des enfants. Elle démarre sa journée à 9h pour  prendre la pose à 13h  et à partir de 16h elle reprend ses travaux champêtres jusqu’à 19h. A l’avenir, elle souhaite cultiver d’autres surfaces et cela ne peut être réalisé sans l’appuie de l’institution et plut art devenir un fournisseur potentiel.
texts.en:
The 'And Book Diom Bou Ndiol' Group is made up of ten women, who live in the same village and get together whenever they need to.  Their president is Sokhna (seen in the photo with her hand raised).  She is 37 years old, married and has children.  She grows vegetables for sale, and will use her loan to buy seeds and other products needed for this work.  She has more than ten years' experience, and grows cabbages, rice, onions and aubergines.

Sokhna helps her husband to provide for the day-to-day expenses of their household, and the school fees of their children.  She starts her working day at 9am, stops between 1pm and 4pm, and then works in the fields again until 7pm.

In the future, she would like to extend the amount of land that she grows vegetables on, but in order to do this, she will need to continue using the support of the field partner.  Further into the future, Sokhna would like to become a supplier of vegetables.

loans.use: to buy seeds and other products for vegetable growing.

loans.name: Book Yakar Ndiol Group

texts.fr: Le groupement AND BOOK YAKAR NDIOL  est un groupement de promotion féminin  qui est composé de 10 personnes. Elles habitent dans le même village et pratiquent la même activité qui est l’agriculture. Elles se réunissent à chaque fois de besoin et organisent des tontines. La femme qui a levé la main sur la photo est leur présidente, elle s’appelle Sokhna. Elle est âgée de 38 ans et mère de famille. Elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter des semences et intrants pour pratiquer le maraichage. C’est une activité qu’elle a pratiqué depuis plus de 5ans. Elle n’a pas de charges particulières  a part ses propres besoins. Elle commence sa journée à7h pour la terminer à 13h et venir à la maison pour préparer le repas de la journée. Elle souhaite grâce aux crédits être en mesure d’exploiter d’autres surfaces afin de pouvoir  augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants.
texts.en: The AND BOOK YAKAR NDIOL group is a female group made up of 10 people. They live in the same village and are in the same business, which is agriculture. They meet each time out of necessity and organize tontines (financial arrangements in which subscribers share a common fund with the benefit of survivorship). The woman with her hand raised in the photo is their president. Her name is Sokhna. She is 38 years old and a mother. She seeks this amount to buy grains and resources to practice truck farming. It’s a business she’s been in for more than 5 years. She has no particular expenses aside from her own personal needs. She starts her day at 7am and finishes at 1pm, then goes home to prepare the day’s meal. She hopes the loan will allow her to make use of other surfaces in order to augment her earnings and improve the living conditions of her children.

loans.use: to buy grains and resources to practice truck farming

loans.name: Sope Sa Dieukeur Ndiol Group

texts.fr: Le groupement SOPE SA DIEKEUR NDIOL est composé de 10 femmes qui habitent dans le même village et font pratiquement la même activité. Il a comme présidente Adiaratou  qui est mariée et mère de famille. On la reconnait sur la photo par la main levée. Elle n’a pas de charges particulières et  a une expérience de plus de 8ans. Elle a besoin de ce montant pour acheter des  semences et intrants  pour cultiver des oignons, des aubergines et des choux. Adiaratou  commence sa journée  à 9h pour y revenir à 16h. A l’avenir, elle voudrait cultiver d’autres surfaces  et augmenter ses revenus  afin de pouvoir améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et en plus épargner de l’argent  à coté.
texts.en: The Sope Sa Diekeur Ndiol group is made up of 10 women who all live in the same village and have very similar businesses. The leader of the group is Adiaratou who is married and a mother. She is the one raising her hand in the picture. She is not responsible for covering any particular expenses and has over 8 years experience in her line of work. She needs this loan so that she can buy seeds and agricultural inputs with which to grow onions, aubergines and cabbages. Adiaratou starts her workday at 9am and returns at 4pm. In the future, she would like to cultivate crops on other plots and to increase her income so that she can improve her family's living conditions and save some money.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Youssou

texts.fr: Monsieur  youssou  accompagnait depuis le bas âge son père, aux champs ce qui a réveillé en lui le métier d’agriculteur .IL a acquis maintenant une expérience de 10 ans. Youssou s’est surtout tourné dans le maraichage plus précisément la culture de pomme de terre. L e crédit va donc lui servir à acheter des semences de pomme de terre et des intrants agricoles. Youssou  passe une longue journée de travail qui démarre à 6h du matin pour se  terminer à 20h du soir ; cela montre aussi tout l’amour qu’il voue à son activité. Marié, Youssou parvient à nourrir convenablement ses enfants et sa famille grâce aux revenus de son activité. Comme projet futur, il aimerait ouvrir un magasin ou il vendrait que des produits agricoles à grande échelle. Ainsi il pourra augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Youssou accompanied his father in the fields since he was a small boy, and this introduced him to agriculture. He now has ten years' experience in this type of work. More specifically, Youssou works in market gardening growing mostly potatoes. 

This loan will serve to buy potato seeds and farm inputs.

Youssou works long days from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m., which also shows how much he loves his work.

Married, Youssou manages to feed his children and family thanks to the earnings from this farming.

In the future, he would like to open a shop where he will sell agricultural products at whole sale. This will allow him to earn more and to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and inputs for market gardening

loans.name: Feddy Gondy Gall Group

texts.fr: FEDDY GONDY GALL est un groupement d'intérêt économique qui est composé de 10 personnes qui habitent dans le même village et qui pratiquent les mêmes activités. Il a comme présidente Madame OURY âgée de 32 ans qui est une femme mariée et mère de famille. On le reconnait sur la photo par la main levé et évolue dans le maraichage. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et  les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle sollicite ce crédit de ce montant pour acheter des  semences et intrants pour pouvoir faire son activité qui est le maraichage et cultiver ses choux, oignon et aubergine. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 19h. elle souhaite à l’avenir augmenter ses revenus en diversifier ses activités et améliorer les conditions de vie sa famille.
texts.en: FEDDY GONDY GALL is a group composed of 10 women all living in the same village and involved in the same business activities. Mrs Oury is the president. She is 32 years old, married, and a mother. She can be seen in the photo with her hand raised. She assists her husband in managing the household expenses and school fees for their children. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase grains and other products to continue her farming activity and to cultivate cabbage, onions and eggplant. She begins working every day at 8 am and finished at 7 pm. She hopes to earn enough revenue in order to further diversify her activity and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: purchase grains and other products for farming

loans.name: Sope Serigne Babacar Sy Group

texts.fr: SOPE SERIGNE BABACAR SY  est un groupement d’intérêt économique qui est composé de 10 personnes. Elles habitent toutes dans le même village et font la même activité. Elles se réunissent à chaque fois de besoin. Il  a comme présidente Sokhna qui a levé  la main sur la photo.  Elle a une expérience de plus de 7 ans et sollicite ce montant pour acheter des semences et intrants pour pratiquer la culture des choux, oignon et aubergines. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 15h car elle doit venir à la maison pour préparer le déjeuner. Elle voudrait diversifier ses activité et augmente ses revenus afin de pouvoir améliorer les conditions de vi de sa famille. En plus de ca elle voudrait avoir une autonomie financière.
texts.en:
Sope Serigne Babacar Sy Group is made up of 10 women. They all live in the same village and run the same businesses. They get together every time there is a need.

The group's president is Sokhna, who is raising her hand in the photograph. She has more than seven years of experience, and is seeking a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers to grow cabbages, onions, and egg plants.

She begins her day at 8 a.m. and finishes it at 3 p.m. because she has to come home to cook. She would like to diversify her business and increase her income, in order to improve the standard of living of her family. Furthermore, she would like to achieve financial autonomy.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Sope Rassoul Group

texts.fr: SOPE RASSOUL  est un groupement de promotion féminin qui regroupe 10 femmes et a comme présidente SALKA qui est une femme mariée et mère de famille ; elle est reconnue sur la photo par la main levée. Elle est âgée de 34ans et évolue dans le maraichage. Elle  a une expérience de plus de 5ans et  n’a pas de charges particulières. Elle commence sa journée à 9h pour y revenir à 13h. SALKA demande ce prêt pour acheter des semences et des intrants pour pratiquer le maraichage. Elle souhaite à l’avenir être en mesure de cultiver d’autres surfaces  en riz et oignon.  Elle voudrait augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de sa vie et celle de ses enfants.
texts.en: Sope Rassoul is a women's promotion group which is made up of 10 women. The leader of the group is Salka, who is married and a mother. She is the one raising her hand in the picture. She is 34 years old and is a market gardener. She has over 5 years experience in this line of work and has no specific expenses to cover. She starts her workday at 9am and returns at 1pm. Salka is requesting this loan so that she can buy seeds and agricultural inputs for her market garden. In the future, she would like to be able to grow rice and onions on other plots. She would like to increase her income and improve her and her children's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Takku Liguey Group

texts.fr: L e groupement TAKKU LIGUEY est un groupement de promotion féminin qui est composé de 10 femmes et qui habitent ensemble dans le même quartier  et font pratiquement les mêmes activités. Leur présidente s’appelle FATOU elle est âgée de 41 ans et c’est elle qui a levé la main sur la photo. Elle évolue dans le maraichage et aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle demande ce crédit d’un montant de 100.000 F pour acheter des semences et intrants  pour la pratique de son maraichage. Elle quitte sa maison à 8h pour y revenir à 20h. Elle voudrait à l’avenir avoir une cantine au marché et y vendre ses récoltes. Ainsi elle  pourra augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et  épargner un peu d’argent à coté.
texts.en:
Takku Liguey Group is made up of ten women who live together in the same neighborhood. Their businesses are very similar.

The group's president, named Fatou, is 41 years old. She's the woman raising her hand in the photograph. She's a cultivator and she helps her husband cover daily expenses and her children's school expenses.

She's seeking a loan of XOF 100'000 to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farming business. She leaves her home at 8 in the morning, and comes back at 8 in the evening.

In the future, she would like to have a booth in the market, where she could sell her crops. Thus, she will be able to increase her income, improve the standard of living of her family, and put some money away.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Macaria

texts.en: Macaria is 63 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and has requested a loan for PHP 16,000 from NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock. Macaria has been in this line of work for 15 years and also earns additional income by running general store. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jona Fe

texts.en: Jona Fe is 40 years old, married and the mother of one child who is currently in school. She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan from NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell. She has been in this line of work for three years and has taken out and repaid three prior loans from NWTF. Her goal for the future is to secure a better life for her family by expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her children's education.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 41 years old and has three children. Maria is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Maria is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Maria requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins, vaccines and other supplies for her business.

Maria has been raising livestock for four years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Maria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, vaccines and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Nieves Miguelita

texts.en:
Nieves Miguelita is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 44 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Nieves Miguelita has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nieves Miguelita has been in this business for 17 years and would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mirna Guadalupe

texts.es:
Mirna tiene 33 años de edad, ella es viuda y tiene 3 hijos ella solo logro estudiar octavo grado, debido a la economía de sus padres al dejar de estudiar ella se dedico a ayudar a su madre con los oficios de la casa y en los trabajos agrícolas de su padres.

Mirna debido a su viudez se dedico a trabajar desde hace seis años, se dedica al comercio de ropa ya que este negocio le genera ganancia y una forma de poder acomodar su tiempo para cuidar a sus pequeños los cuales le acompañan en la venta de vez en cuando para ayudarle en las diez cuadras a la redonda que ella recorre dos veces a la semana. También ella por las mañanas  se dedica a la venta de tortillas lo cual le da otra pequeña entrada de dinero vendiéndole tortillas a los vecinos, con este préstamo Mirna tiene la oportunidad de comprar más mercadería para su negocio creciendo un poco más, para llegar a la meta de darles una mejor vida a sus pequeños esperando en un futuro, ellos se preparen estudiando para ser unas personas de bien.

Los fondos del crédito serán destinados a la compra de ropa para vender y de de materiales para la preparación de las tortillas y comprar una cocina  a gas el sueño mas grande que tiene es darles el estudio a sus hijos hasta donde sea posible y tengan una mejor oportunidad para mejorar la condición de vida a travez de un mejor trabajo, y con mucho esfuerzo lograr comprar una casa para su familia
texts.en:
Mirna is 33 years old and a widow with 3 children. She only managed to study up to 8th grade, due to her parents' economic condition. She helps her mother with house work and her parents with their agricultural labor.

Mirna, owing to her widowhood, has worked for the last 6 years selling clothes. This business generates earnings and it is a form of passing the time while she cares for her children, who accompany her during sales efforts, from time to time, as she makes the rounds of the 10 blocks she covers twice a week. Also, mornings, she sells tortillas to her neighbors, which provides another source of money. With this loan Mirna will be able to purchase more merchandise for her business, growing a little more, to arrive at her goal of offering a better life to her little ones, and aspiring to a future. They are preparing themselves, studying to become better persons.

The funds from the loan will be used to purchase clothing to sell and to buy ingredients for preparing tortillas, and, also, to buy a gas stove. Mirna's greatest dream is to offer schooling to her children as long as possible and for them to have a greater opportunity to achieve a better condition in life through  work, and with her great effort, to be able to purchase a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell and a gas stove and more ingredients for making tortillas to sell.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida is 55 years old and single.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan from NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock. Zenaida has been in this business for three years, and has taken out and repaid five prior loans from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for an efficient and affordable cooking gas package.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for more efficient kitchen energy using liquefied petroleum gas.

loans.name: Josia Elieser

texts.es: Josia tiene 33 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos de 12 años, 10 años y 7 años de edad. Josia trabaja como empleado en un taller de estructuras metálicas y de esta forma es como se gana la vida y junto a su  compañera de vida mantienen la economía del hogar. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones de vida ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI  para invertir en la reparación del techo de la vivienda para lo cual necesita comprar materiales como: lámina galvanizada, clavos y polines. No cuenta con el capital para hacer el desembolso por lo que espera este poder obtener el financiamiento.
texts.en:
Josia is 33 years old and lives in a house that he owns with his partner and their three children, aged twelve, ten and seven years old respectively. Josia works in an ironmongery and earns a living through this job. With his partner, the couple is able to support the household. 

In order to improve his living conditions, Josia has decided to apply for a loan from "FUSAI" to invest in repairing the roof of his home. To do this, he needs to buy materials such as galvanised metal sheeting, nails and purlins. Josia does not have the money to spend on this work and hopes to receive this loan.

loans.use: to buy galvanised metal sheeting, nails, and purlins to repair the roof of his home.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy house building materials like sand, nails, cements, tiles, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business farming bananas in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,500 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies for her banana business.

Pacita has been in this business for 13 years. Pacita also earns income from buying and selling charcoal.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Pacita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Precila

texts.en:
Precila is 59 years old and married with five children.

Precila works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase  biscuits, candies, snack foods, noodles, canned goods, milk, coffee, etc. to sell.

Precila has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and earns additional income from coconut wine vending.

Precila aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase biscuits, candies, snack foods, noodles, canned goods, milk, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Shalimar

texts.en:
Shalimar is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Shalimar is 56 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Shalimar has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Shalimar has been in this business for five years. In the future, Shalimar would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Socoro

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Socorro works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling furniture and raising cattle. Socorro is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Socorro has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from 2012 to 2014 from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Wevina

texts.en:
Wevina is 49 years old and married with five children, one currently in school.  Wevina works very hard to provide for them.

Wevina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like snack foods, soft drinks, canned goods, bread and biscuits to sell.

Wevina has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, soft drinks, canned goods, bread and biscuits. 

Wevina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snack foods, soft drinks, canned goods, bread and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Cecilyn

texts.en: Cecilyn is 32 years old and has a live-in partner with whom she has three children. All three are currently in school, and she works very hard to provide for them. She earns a living by running a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan from NWTF to buy more items to sell, including bread, sugar, juice, soft drinks, detergent, cooking oil, and more. Cecilyn has been in this business for one year and would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, including bread, sugar, juice, soft drinks, detergent, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies to help her coffee crops this season.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa de una mujer de 68 años de edad, luchadora y esmerada, madre de 3 hijos. Ella no tiene un nivel académico debido a los escasos recursos económicos, por los que paso desde su infancia. Vive junto a su hijo de 19 años y su hija de 17 años, sus hijos estudiaron hasta educación básica, estos jóvenes son los que le apoyan con los gastos económicos.

 Rosa se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace ya 15 años. Conoce muy bien la actividad que ejerce, ya que una amiga le ayudo a conocer bien el trabajo.
Rosa necesita el crédito para mejorar su vivienda y comprar lamina, clavos y madera, ademas invertirá un porcentaje  para comprar mas ropa(camisas, faldas, pantalones entre otros).
 Rosa planea tener un negocio que le sea rentable para el sostenimiento de su familia y que sus hijos conozcan una actividad que les permita cumplir sus metas y poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 68 year old woman. She is a fighter and conscientious, and mother of 3. She does not have an academic level due to her few economic resources, for which she has dealt with since her infancy. She lives together with her 19 year old son and 17 year old daughter. Her children studied through basic education, and are who help her with the economic costs. 

Rosa is dedicated to the sale of clothing and has been for 15 years. She understands well the activity that she practices, since a friend helped her to understand the work. 

Rosa needs the loan to improve her home and to purchase sheet metal, nails and wood. She will also invest a percentage to purchase more clothing (shirts, skirts and pants among others). 

Rosa plans to have a business that is profitable for the support of her family and that her children can know an activity that permits them to achieve their goals and be able to come out ahead.

loans.use: to purchase sheet metal, nails and wood, she will also invest a percentage to purchase more clothing (shirts, skirts and pants among others).

loans.name: Diana Consuelo

texts.es: Diana es una señora soltera que tiene 2 hijos de4 y 7 años los que se encuentran asistiendo a la escuela, ella se dedica a la ganadería, ordeña las  vacas  y vende la leche para obtener los ingresos que le permiten cubrir sus gastos y los de sus hijos, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca, Diana tiene 27 años  de edad y dice que tiene toda una vida por delante para que darles a su hijos todo lo que  necesiten y que luchara hasta verle hechos todo unos profesionales.
texts.en:
Diana is the single mom of two children who are 4 and 7 years old, both of whom are attending school. She raises cattle, milks the cows and sells the milk in order to earn the income she needs to cover her expenses and those of her children. 

She plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in a cow. At 27 years old, Diana says that she has her whole life ahead of her to give her children all that they need, and will keep fighting until she sees them become professionals.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa est revendeuse de produits d'alimentation générale et des articles de mercerie. A 35 ans, elle habite à Lomé avec son mari revendeur et ses enfants.  Akossiwa a commencé son activité il y a 14 ans et emploie aujourd'hui une salariée pour l'aider. Akossiwa réalise son quatrième cycle de prêt chez Wages. De nouveau elle a sollicité un crédit afin d'augmenter son stock en produits alimentation générale et des produits de mercerie. Elle compte réemployer les profits qu'elle réalisera à l'aménagement de sa boutique. Elle espère à plus long terme pouvoir ouvrir une seconde boutique.
texts.en:
Akossiwa is a retailer of grocery items and sewing supplies. She is 35 years old and lives in Lomé with her husband, a retailer, and their children. She started her business fourteen years ago. Today, she employs one salaried worker to help her. 

Akossiwa is completing her fourth loan cycle with the field partner, Wages. She is requesting this loan to increase her stock of grocery food products and sewing supplies. She plans to redeploy the profits she makes to renovate her shop. 

Over the long term, she hopes to be able to open a second shop.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and sewing supplies to sell

loans.name: Tuzamuke Group

texts.fr:
Augustin fait partie du groupe  Tuzamuke  et  habite à Bujumbura. Il est marié à Daphrose, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants  âgés de 1 an 3 mois à 5 ans. 

Il fait le commerce de boutique (haricot, bassins, riz,…) depuis 2 ans. 

C’est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de haricot et de riz  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait acheter une parcelle et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Augustin is a member of the Tuzamuke group and lives in Bujumbura. He is married to Daphrose, a farmer. They have three children between the ages of one year three months and five years.

He has been selling products in a shop (beans, bowls, rice...) for two years.

This is his first loan from Turame. With the Kiva credit that he requests, he intends to increase his capital and buy a bigger quantity of beans and rice for resale, to earn more.

In the coming years he hopes to buy a plot of land and see his children study.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a bigger quantity of beans and rice for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Nueva Generación  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Nueva Generación está formado por 15 mujeres quienes son amigas y conocidas, viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera de mayor importancia a nivel económico del país, tiene riqueza natural, arquitectónica y cultural, su variada gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños, su gente es culta y amable. Las  socias son personas muy alegres, carismáticas y trabajadoras que realizan varias actividades diarias las mismas que les permiten aportar económicamente en sus hogares para salir adelante.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Digna, forma parte del grupo de crédito Nueva Generación desde hace 2 años, tiempo en el que llegado a tener una muy buena amistad con todas las socias.
La Señora Digna tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 21 y 18 años que estudian en un colegio de la ciudad, su esposo labora en una mecánica que es de su propiedad, la casa en donde viven es propia.
Doña Digna tiene una ferretería desde hace 3 años, labora sin un horario fijo y de lunes a sábados, también desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de productos naturales onmilife. Estos trabajos el dan la oportunidad de pasar con su familia. 
El dinero de su crédito es para la compra de artículos de ferretería. Su meta es viajar a diferentes partes del mundo.
texts.en:
The credit group Nueva Generación (New Generation) is made up of 15 women who are friends and acquaintances and live in the city of Cuenca. This is the third most important city in Ecuador economically and is rich in natural, cultural and architectural resources. Its varied cuisine appeals to locals and foreign visitors alike, and its people are cultured and kind.

The group's members are happy, charismatic, and hard-working women, who engage in a variety of daily activities which allow them to contribute financially to their households and thus get ahead. One of the group's members, Digna, joined the Nueva Generacion credit group two years ago, during which time she has formed strong friendships with all of the members. She is 36 years old, married and has two children who are 18 and 21 years old and are students at a local school. Her husband works as a mechanic in his own shop, and they own their home. 

Digna has had her own hardware store for the past three years. She works from Monday to Saturday with no set schedule. She has also been selling Omnilife natural products for the past two years. The work she does allows her to spend time with her family. The money from the loan is to buy items for her hardware store. Her goal is to travel to different parts of the world.

loans.use: to buy hardware items.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos Alberto es un pequeño productor de Nicaragua, con 58 años de edad y con excelentes condiciones físicas y habilidades para trabajar. Tiene una finca de 21 hectáreas de las cuales 2 son destinadas al cultivo de café. Los rendimientos de café de este productor han venido mejorando en los últimos 3 ciclos, pasando de 25 a 40 quintales, debido a la implementación de las recomendaciones brindadas por el equipo técnico de la asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria a la cual pertenece.

Para este ciclo, la meta de este productor es mejorar la calidad e incrementar los rendimientos de su café, a través de un manejo semi tecnificado de su plantación. Para esto, Carlos Alberto está solicitando un financiamiento que le permita garantizar los insumos y fertilizantes necesarios para el mantenimiento de su café, y con los ingresos generados invertir en el establecimiento de nuevas áreas ya que para él una de las ventajas de este cultivo es su rentabilidad.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto is a small farmer in Nicaragua. He is 58 years old and is in excellent physical condition to work. He has 50 acres of land and is growing coffee on five of them. He belongs to the association Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria, and his coffee production has been improving over the past three cycles.The association's technical team made a series of recommendations, and implementing them resulted in an increase in production from 2.5 to 4 tons.

His goal for this cycle is to improve his coffee's quality and increase profitability by managing his plantation semi-technically. In order to achieve this, Carlos Alberto is requesting a loan so that he can secure the supplies and fertilizer he needs to maintain his coffee plants. He will invest the income he generates into establishing new areas, because to him one of the advantages of this crop is its profitability.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizer to maintain his coffee crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a more efficient cooking gas package.

loans.name: Farangez

texts.ru: Фарангез скромная и трудолюбивая женщина из района Шахритус. Ей 26 лет. Она живет с мужем и его семьей в селе. Все они занимаются растениеводством. Фарангез еще в хозяйстве имеет одну корову с теленком, которая каждое утро дает ей молока. Она сама ухаживает за ней и ее теленком. Фарангез решила превратить свое хобби в бизнес. Она планирует начать деятельность по откорму и продаже скота, поскольку у нее есть все условия для ведения этой деятельности. Фарангез имеет начальный капитал в размере 200 долларов США. Так как для купли бычков ей не хватает средств, она обратилась за кредитом. Этот кредит очень важен Фарангез. Она хочет доказать всем, что сможет начать и вести свой бизнес. Поддержите ее.
texts.en: Farangez is a modest and hardworking woman from the Shahrituz region. She is 26 and lives with her husband and his family in a village. They all work in agriculture, and Farangez also has a calf and a cow, who every morning gives her milk. She takes care of them both herself. Farangez has decided to turn her hobby into a business. She plans to start fattening and selling livestock, since she already has all the necessary infrastructure. She has about $200 USD in starting capital, which is not enough to buy steers, and so she needs to borrow some money. This loan is very important to Farangez. She wants to prove to everyone that she can start and maintain her business. Please support her.

loans.use: to acquire young steers and start a business fattening and selling livestock

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 41 years old and has a live-in partner, with four children who are currently in school. Lourdes works very hard to provide for them.

Lourdes runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more items to sell, like candies, biscuits, cooking oil, canned goods, and detergent soap.

Lourdes has been in this business for two years and she sells a variety of items, such as candies, biscuits, cooking oil, canned goods, and detergent soap. 

In the future, Lourdes would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell, like candies, biscuits, cooking oil, canned goods, and detergent soap.

loans.name: Tupatane Group

texts.fr: La cliente Gakamba est une commerçante et membre du groupe d’affaires «Tupatane», entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de 55 ans et mère de 8 enfants, dont 6 étudient et 2 sont encore gosses. Elle est propriétaire d’un  restaurant/cafeteria. Elle organise son service dans une maison au marché central de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Elle y a 5 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter  de sacs de farine de manioc et de maïs, du riz, 1 cartons du lait, 1/2 sac se sucre, 10 kg de viande, 5 litres d’huile, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser, nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, surtout; pendant ce moment difficile post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays. Il sied de signaler qu'une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
Gakamba is a retailer and member of the business group, Tupatane.  She is a dynamic entrepreneur who is 55 years old and mother to eight children, six of whom attend school and two of whom are too young.  She runs a restaurant/cafeteria from a house in the central market of the town.  Gakamba started her business five years ago, with funds provided by her husband and then started working with the field partner, Hekima.

She will use her loan to buy sacks of cassava flour, maize and rice, one box of milk, half a sack of sugar, ten kilos of meat and five litres of oil.  This will improve the business figures of her restaurant and will enable her to feed and educate her children.

Gakamba is very grateful to Hekima for the help they provide to enable non-bankable women to become independent.  This is especially important during this difficult time post conflict in the east of the country.

It should be noted that one of the group members has her baby with her in the photo.

loans.use: to buy sacks of cassava flour, maize and rice, 1 box of milk, 1/2 sack of sugar, 10 kg of meat and 5 litres of oil for use in her restaurant business.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Charito requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Charito has been in this business for four years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 41 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Eden has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more fish to sell.

Eden has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, Eden would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 60 years old and married, with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Erlinda has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for six years. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Nyambere Group

texts.fr:
Suavis  fait partie du groupe  Nyambere  et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 32 ans et est mariée à Paul, un commercant. Ensemble ils ont  2 à 4 ans. 

Elle fait le commerce de  pomme de terre depuis 4 ans. 

Elle est à son quatrième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de  kilos de pomme de terre à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Suavis is a member of the business group Nyambere, and lives in Gitega.  She is 32 years old and married to Paul, a retailer.  Together they have children aged between two and four years old.

Suavis has been selling potatoes for four years now.  This will be her fourth loan with the field partner, Turame.  She will use her loan to increase her working capital and buy many kilos of potatoes which she will sell.  In this way, Suavis hopes to increase her earnings.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy many kilos of potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Tujimbere Group

texts.fr:
Béatrice  fait partie du groupe  Tujimbere  et  habite à Gitega. C’est une veuve de  51 ans. Elle a 8 enfants âgés de 10 à 23 ans, dont 7 étudient.
Elle a sous sa charge 2 orphelins.

Elle fait le commerce de  chèvres  depuis 9 ans. 

Elle est à son douzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de chèvres à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Beatrice is a member of the Tujimbere Group and lives in Gitega.  She is 51 years old and a widow.  Beatrice has eight children aged between ten and 23 years old.  Seven of her children currently attend school.  She is also financially responsible for two orphans.

Beatrice has been buying and selling goats for nine years now.  This will be her twelfth loan with the field partner, Turame.  She will use her loan to increase her working capital and buy many goats to resell.  In this way she will increase her earnings.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy several goats for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags of beans and bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Madame Afi malgré son age avancé se bat chaque fois pour apporter le meilleur d'elle même à sa famille composée de 04 enfants et de son conjoint qui est retraité. Pour cela, elle revend des denrées alimentaires depuis 1985 à domicile.Manquant de fonds pour s'approvisionner en marchandises, elle sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter des denrées alimentaires(tomates, piments, oignons....) afin de satisfaire ses clients. Elle espère aménager son lieu de vente avec le profit qu'elle va tirer de la vente et contribuer au bien - être de la famille.
texts.en:
Despite being an older woman, Afi still works very hard to provide the best for her family of four children, and her retired husband.  In order to do this, she has sold food products from her home since 1985.

As she lacks sufficient funds to buy enough stock, Afi has requested this loan from the field partner.  She will use her loan to buy food products (tomatoes, chillies, onions, etc).  This will allow her to satisfy the demands of her customers.

Afi will use her profits in order to renovate her sales area and to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy food products for resale.

loans.name: Melecia

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Melecia works hard to support her family.

She has a manicure/pedicure service business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear. Melecia is borrowing PHP 11,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional materials for her manicure/pedicure service business, like nail polish, nail cutters, and nippers.

Melecia has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business, like nail polish, nail cutters, and nippers.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell fishing supplies/materials business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more stocks of fishing materials to sell through her buy-and-sell fishing supplies/materials business.

Helen has been in this business for ten years. She earns additional income from pig-fattening, farming coconuts, and food-vending.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of fishing materials to sell.

loans.name: Dúo Bondad Group

texts.es:
Dúo Bondad
Dúo formado por Telma Alicia ambas originarias de el paraje el sauce aldea xesuj. Las dos se dedican a la elaboración de tejidos típicos. Venden sus güipiles en el mercado municipal. Lo que ellas anhelan es tener más capital para poder comprar más hilo y materiales para la elaboración de sus güipiles, y así obtener mejores ingresos para así ayudar a sus esposos al mantenimiento de sus hogares. Es el primer crédito que solicitan a kiva.Estan solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion y venta de tejidos tipicos.
texts.en:
“Bondad” (Kindness) Group

This group includes Telma Alicia. She and her fellow group member are from the neighborhood of Xesuj, which is in the area of El Sauce. The two of them make traditional woven goods. They sell these dresses at the municipal market. Both of them would like to have more capital so that they can buy thread and materials for making traditional woven dresses. This will allow them to generate more income so that they can help their spouses with maintaining their households.

This is the first time they have requested a loan from Kiva. They are requesting a loan so that they can buy raw materials for making and selling traditional woven goods.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making traditional woven goods.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 59 years old and widowed, with two children.

Remedios works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Remedios has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear.

Remedios aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Stella is 36 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Stella has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell to her customers.

Stella has been in this business for nine years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Adelita

texts.en:
Adelita is 36 years old and married, with five children.

Adelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional stocks to sell, like canned goods, rice, soft drinks, beer, snack foods, and cereals.

Adelita has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling firewood.

Adelita aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell, like canned goods, rice, soft drinks, beer, snack foods, and cereals.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy margi, salt, pepper, fish, etc. to add to her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy onions, margi, etc. in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.name: Fanny Rocio

texts.es: Rocio tiene 23 años de edad, ella es soltera, vive con sus padres y  se dedica a criar chanchos también ayuda a sus padres  a la ganadería y agricultura, comenta que le va bien en el negocio de chanchos ya que les da un buen cuidado a sus animales, el crédito lo va a invertir comprando una chancha para tenerla hasta que de cría, la aspiración de Rocio es que su negocio  se incremente y seguir luchando como hasta ahora.
texts.en:
Rocio is 23 years old, is single and lives with her parents. She works rearing pigs, and also helps her parents with their livestock and crops. She says that her pig business is going well for her, as she looks after her animals well. 

She will invest the loan in buying a sow to keep until she gives birth to piglets. Rocio's ambition is to grow her business and to keep striving as she has up to now.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de La Matanza, una comunidad tranquila de clima cálido, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morrropon que pertenece a la Región, Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta y preparación se chicha de jora, cerveza, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, dedicándose a esta actividad desde hace tres años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de diversos productos como maíz amarillo, azúcar entre otros y de esta manera seguir con la producción de chicha de jora que es una bebida típica de la costa norte del Perú.
texts.en:
Paulina is 36 years old and lives with her husband and children in the District of La Matanza, a peaceful community with a warm climate. The people engage in agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. This area is located in Morropon Province, which is part of the region of Piura on the northern coast of Peru.

Paulina prepares and sells “chicha de jora” (a traditional beverage made from corn) and beer. Her business is located at her home and she has been in this line of work for three years. Paulina is requesting a loan of 3,000 PEN in order to buy various supplies such as yellow corn, sugar, and other items. This will enable her to continue her production of “chicha de jora”, a beverage that is traditional to the northern coast of Peru.

loans.use: to buy yellow corn, sugar, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a large quantity and wide variety of clothes to add to her current inventory.

loans.name: Norma Lisandra

texts.es: Norma tiene 31 años de edad y se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace 9 años. Ella habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida, dos hijos y tres sobrinos. Norma es una mujer trabajadora quien hace todo lo que este a su alcance para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Con mucho esfuerzo junto a su compañero de vida han comenzado a construir su vivienda con materiales más resistentes y por falta de recursos económicos no han logrado terminar. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de polines y hierra para terminar el techo de la vivienda y poder mudarse lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Norma is 31 years old and has been providing housekeeping services for nine years. She resides in her own home along with her life companion, her two children, and three nephews and nieces.

Norma is a hardworking woman who does everything she can to sustain her household. With great effort, she and her companion have started the construction of their home with the use of resilient materials. However, they lack the financial resources that are needed to reach completion. For this reason, Norma is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to buy beams and iron to finish the roof of her house so that she can move her family in as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy beams and iron so that she can complete the roof of her house.

loans.name: Cesarea

texts.es: Cesarea se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y regalos, ella una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en uno de los bancos comunales de la Asociación Arariwa y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo perfumes, collares, aretes, pinta labios, desodorantes, ropa y otras cosas, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Cesarea sells cosmetics and gifts. She is a responsible person who was invited to participate in one of the Communal Banks affiliated with Asociación Arariwa.

Cesarea is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy merchandise such as perfumes, necklaces, earrings, lipsticks, deodorants, clothes, and other items. She appreciates and values this loan, so she promises to handle her monthly payments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, necklaces, earrings, lipsticks, deodorants, clothes, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Marily Esmeralda

texts.es: Marily tiene 19 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeña hija de un año de edad. Marily se gana la vida por medio de la venta de ropa nueva y lociones. Tiene tres años de contar con este negocio y lo hace de forma ambulante en las principales zonas de su localidad. Marily solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, polines y clavos para cambiar el techo de la vivienda lo antes posible ya que se encuentra en mal estado.
texts.en:
Marily is 19 years old and lives in her own home together with her partner and one-year-old daughter. She earns her living by selling new clothes and lotions. She has had this business for three years and sells her goods as a mobile street vendor in the main commercial zones in her area.

Marily is seeking this loan via FUSAI in order to invest it in buying galvanized metal sheeting, rivets and nails to replace the roof of her home as soon as possible, as it is in poor condition.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheeting, rivets and nails to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy foodstuffs like mayonnaise, cheese, sugar, butter, milk and drinks to add to his grocery store inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials for repairing the roof of her house.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
La Señora. Ana forma parte del grupo de crédito San Vicente desde hace 6 años, le gusta este grupo de crédito porque en todo este tiempo han formado una familia, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia Victoria del Portete en Cuenca, en donde la mayor parte de su población se dedican a la ganadería y a la agricultura, mucha de su población ha salido a la ciudad a trabajar en varias actividades como también han migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo.
La Señora. Ana tiene 32 años de edad, es casada fruto y de su unión conyugal  ha concebido 6 hijos de 13, 10, 5, 2 años  y sus gemelos de un año de edad, su primera hija está en el colegio y dos de sus hijos estudian en la escuela, su esposo labora en la área de la construcción, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de un familiar.
Doña Ana  se dedica a la cría de pollos, cuyes y ganado del cual vende a leche, también se dedica a la agricultura es para el consumo de su hogar y si existe un sobrante lo vende. En esta ocasión el dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de ventanas para su casa y así poco a poco ir cumpliendo su meta de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana has been part of the San Vincente Communal Bank for six years. She likes this group because everyone has been like family the entire time. Ana lives in one of the surrounding neighborhoods of Victoria del Portete Parish in Cuenca. Most of the people are devoted to agriculture and livestock breeding. Many residents leave the city so that they can work in various business activities, but there are also some who have migrated in search of a better job.

Sra. Ana is 32 years old, married, and has six children (ages 13, 10, 5, 2, and one-year-old twins). Her oldest daughter is in high school and the next two children are in elementary school. Ana’s husband works in the construction sector. They do not own a home, so they currently live at a relative’s house.

Doña Ana raises chickens, guinea pigs, and also has cows for selling milk. In addition, she grows crops for household consumption. She sells any excess that is produced. On this occasion, the money from her loan will be invested in the purchase of windows for her house. This will help her to gradually reach her goal of having a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy windows for her future house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a respectable house for her family

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael tiene 51 años de edad, es un caficultor de una comunidad del departamento de Jinotega. Vive  con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en una finca de 28.16 hectáreas, de las cuales 11.26 hectáreas han sido destinadas para el cultivo de café. En los últimos 3 años su producción ha sido de 300 a 500 quintales de café pergamino, la cual se encuentra bajo la certificación de comercio justo (FLO), C.A.F.E. Practices y UTZ. 

Su meta para el 2019 es llegar a tener 21 hectáreas de café con las mejores condiciones para la producción. Por lo tanto, está solicitando un financiamiento que le permita invertir en el establecimiento de 2 hectáreas más de café. El dice “se comienza con poco, y luego se va reinvirtiendo, así he venido creciendo y pienso seguir haciéndolo para brindar mejores condiciones a mi familia”.

Para este pequeño productor los principales retos en el cultivo de café son las plagas y enfermedades, pero se puede hacer frente a esto con un buen manejo, lo cual ha venido realizando con la asistencia y recursos brindados por la asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria. 

Por lo tanto solicita un crédito para darle un mejor mantenimiento y manejo a la plantación (semitecnificado) y alcanzar mejores rendimientos productivos.
texts.en:
Rafael, age 51, is a coffee farmer in a community in the Jinotega department.  He lives with his wife and their three children on a farm that is 28.16 hectares.  Of those, 11.26 hectares are used for growing coffee.  In the last three years, his production has been from 300 to 500 ‘quintales’ [a quintal is about 100 pounds] of parchment coffee.  It is certified fair trade (FLO), C.A.F.E. Practices and UTZ. 

His goal is in 2019 to come to have 21 hectares of coffee with the best conditions for production.  Therefore, he is requesting a loan that will allow him to invest in establishing two more hectares of coffee.  He says, “You start with a little, and then you are reinvesting.  This way I have been growing and plan to continue doing so in order to provide my family with better conditions”.

For this small producer the main challenges to growing coffee are the pests and diseases.  However, he can cope with this with good management.  He has been doing this by caring for his crops and with resources provided by the Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria association.

He is therefore requesting this loan to provide better maintenance and to manage the planting (semi-technological) and to manage improved productive yields.

loans.use: to establish two more hectares of coffee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a safe and respectable house for the family

loans.name: Esperanza Y Progreso Group

texts.es: Helen es socia del grupo “Esperanza Y Progreso” constituida por 09 personas activas y responsables. Helen de 30 años es soltera. Ella labora en una clínica como terapeuta física. Gracias a su profesión Le ha permitido a  Helen mejorar su calidad de vida. A  si mismo tiene proyectado alquilar su propio local. Con el fin de seguir mejorando solicitó el crédito para la compra de pinturas, calaminas y brochas.  El grupo “Esperanza Y Progreso” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Helen es la segunda del lado izquierdo,  viste bivirí blanco.
texts.en: Helen is a member of the group “Esperanza Y Progreso” or "Hope and Progress" made up of 9 active and responsible people. Helen is 30 years old and single. She works in a clinic as a physical therapist. Thanks to her profession she has been able to improve her quality of life. She is also projected to rent her own place. With the goal of continuing to improve, she requested a credit for the purchase of paint, roofing and brushes. The group “Esperanza Y Progreso” is grateful to the people that made this loan possible. Helen is the second person from the left in the white top.

loans.use: to buy paints, roofing, and brushes.

loans.name: Etevise

texts.en:
Etevise is a 21-year-old single woman with no children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has five years of experience with this business.
