Etevise needs a loan to buy sacks of flour, sacks of sugar, baking powder, a frying pan and dripping oil. She plans to use her profits to save in the bank for rainy days. 

Etevise became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, sacks of sugar, baking powder, a frying pan and dripping oil.

loans.name: Khadeejeh

texts.en:
Khadeejeh is a 25-year-old married woman. She has three children and she lives in Gaza.

In 2012, she decided to do something to contribute to the family income as her husband’s income alone is not sufficient to fulfill the demands of his family members. She started sewing clothes for many shops.

Her dream is to open a business with a large number of employees working in her business to give them the opportunity to work and get income.
 
Khadeejeh is asking Ryada for this loan to buy a sewing machine, fabric and threads. She is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, fabric and threads.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his college tuition and fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's education.

loans.name: Julia Melcy

texts.es:
Julia Melcy tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad de clima caluroso su población se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente de frutales, café y arroz, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella brinda servicio de computación en el Centro Médico de su distrito, tiene una familia unida, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de una impresora para brindar servicio de impresión y arreglo de su computadora para seguir brindando este servicio y generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Julia Melcy is 33 years old and lives with her husband and children in the District of Pucará, a community with a warm climate. The people engage in agriculture, especially the cultivation of fruit, coffee, and rice. They also work in trade and livestock breeding. This area is located in Jaén Province, which is part of the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru.

Julia provides computer services at a medical center in her district. She has a close family. Julia is requesting a loan of 1,000 PEN in order to buy a printer for offering printing services. She will also have her computer repaired so that she can continue providing this service and generating additional income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a printer and pay for computer repairs.

loans.name: Analu

texts.en:
Analu is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Analu is 33 years old, and has three children who are in school.

Analu has a business buying and seing dry goods in the Philippines. Analu requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of dry goods like blouses, shorts, bags, kitchen wares, etc. to sell.  Analu has been in this business for six years. 

In the future, Analu would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of dry goods like blouses, shorts, bags, kitchen wares, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Casilda

texts.en:
Casilda works hard to support her family. Casilda is married, and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Casilda requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.  Casilda has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Casilda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a more efficient and an affordable cooking gas package

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for an efficient and modern cooking gas package

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz works hard to support her family. Beatriz is married, and has an electronic mobile re-load retailing business in the Philippines.

Beatriz requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional amount of electronic mobile re-load to sell.  Beatriz has been in this business for five years now.  

Beatriz would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional electronic mobile re-load to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a modern efficient cooking gas package

loans.name: Bernadita

texts.en:
Bernadita is 49 years old and married, with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Bernadita has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. Bernadita requested a PHP 17,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell, like pants, shoes, t-shirts, and blouses.

Bernadita has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell, like pants, shoes, t-shirts, and blouses.

loans.name: Israel

texts.es: Israel tiene 50 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo de 7 años de edad quien se encuentra estudiando. Junto a su esposa mantienen la economía del hogar por medio de la comercialización de elotes locos, atol de elote, tamales, etc. Israel es un hombre trabajador y emprendedora quien no duda de salir todos los días a recorrer las principales zonas de su localidad con un canasto donde lleva los productos para la venta. Israel desea mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de polines, madera, lámina galvanizada, cemento y arena para reparar el techo de la vivienda y para encementar el piso de la misma.
texts.en:
Israel is 50 years old and resides in his own home along with his life companion and their seven-year-old son who is in school. He and his wife sustain their household by selling “elotes locos” (corn on the cob dressed with various toppings), corn porridge, tamales, and other dishes.

Israel is a hardworking and enterprising man who does not hesitate to travel every day through the main areas of his town with a basket full of products to sell. He wants to improve the conditions of his home, so he decided to request a loan from FUSAI. Israel will invest in the purchase of beams, wood, galvanized sheets, cement, and sand so that he can repair the roof of his home and lay down a cement floor.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for repairing the roof of his house and installing a cement floor.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Dioscora is 41 years old, and has two children who are currently in school.

Dioscora has a frozen foods vending business in the Philippines. Dioscora requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell.  Dioscora has been in this business for two years.  

In the future, Dioscora would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Elma Lou

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Elma Lou works hard to support her family.

She has a purified drinking water business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from mobile phone sim card retailing. Elma Lou is borrowing PHP 25,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional containers of purified drinking water to sell.

Elma Lou has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional containers of purified drinking water to sell.

loans.name: Erwina

texts.en:
Erwina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Erwina is 41 years old and has four children who are in school.

Erwina has a business in the Philippines, direct selling Tupperware products. Erwina requested a loan of 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more products to sell to her customers. Erwina has been in this business for five years. In the future, Erwina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. Evelyn is married, and has a frozen foods vending business in the Philippines.

Evelyn requested a PHP 15,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional packs of frozen foods to sell.  Evelyn has been in this business for nine years now.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional packs of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina is single and has a rug making business in the Philippines.

Faustina requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fabric for her business.

Faustina has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Faustina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fabric for her business

loans.name: Ruth Noemi

texts.es:
La tecnología se ha convertido en el mejor aliado de Ruth, puesto que le permite realizar los trabajos con facilidad y rapidez; al mismo tiempo entregarlos en tiempo y forma a través de la internet. Ella tiene 19 años de edad y cursa cuarto año de la carrera de contabilidad. Es una joven  inteligente, emprendedora y responsable. Trabaja vendiendo en una carnicería para contribuir en los gastos económicos de su familia, quienes son su fuente de motivación.
Ella solicita el financiamiento para la compra de una Tablet, dispositivo que le será útil para trabajar y acceder a internet desde cualquier lugar; quiere aprovechar las nuevas tecnologías para obtener mejores resultados. Es amante de su carrera, en la que anhela ser mejor cada día,  por lo tanto deposita su confianza en el préstamo que brinda Kiva y MiCrédito. Su más preciado sueño es lograr culminar sus estudios con excelentes notas, espera trabajar en una empresa en la que desarrolle todos los conocimientos adquiridos.
texts.en:
Technology has become Ruth's greatest ally. It allows her to carry out her work quickly and easily, and to turn in her assignments on time and in good shape via the internet. She is 19 years old and is in her fourth year of an accounting degree. She is an intelligent, enterprising and responsible young person. In addition to her studies, she works as a vendor in a butcher's shop, in order to contribute to the living expenses of her family, who are her source of motivation. 

She is seeking this loan in order to buy a tablet computer, which will be useful for her to work and access the internet from anywhere; she wishes to take advantage of new technologies to get better results. She loves her degree, in which she aspires to be better every day, which is why she is placing her hopes in a loan from Kiva and MiCrédito. Her most cherished dream is to complete her studies with excellent grades, and to work in a company where she will be able to use and develop all that she has learned.

loans.use: to buy a tablet computer.

loans.name: Carolyn

texts.en:
Carolyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Carolyn is 35 years old and has four children who are in school.

Carolyn has a beauty products business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more products to sell, like body spray, perfume, and lotion.

Carolyn has been in this business for nine years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell, like body spray, perfume, and lotion.

loans.name: Katherine

texts.en:
Katherine and her best friend Brooke (not pictured) seemed to have been destined to go into business together from the beginning. Both were in monotonous 9 to 5 jobs and felt frustrated that they weren't making any kind of difference in the world. One day in Katherine’s backyard, they talked about starting their own business together, utilizing natural essential oils to make everything from beauty to home care products. The next week, they got their business license and started KB Pure Essentials. 

The duo makes all of their products at Katherine’s house. Using recipes from doterra.com as their foundation, they modify them in search of the perfect combination of ingredients. What makes Katherine and Brooke such a great team is that they have a unified vision for where they want to take their business. They also each have their own niche in the company and are passionate about what they do; Brooke handles the business aspects, while Katherine is the chemist who creates their products. 

“Everything in our products you can pronounce,” said Brooke, who now only uses the products they sell in her own home. “I haven’t been to a grocery store in two months, and I feel great.” 

They currently sell their products online and at the local farmers’ markets.  They also employ three of their friends, who help at the markets and in the kitchen creating products.

The main challenge that the team faces during the start-up phase of their business is having the cash flow necessary to purchase ingredients for their products and to pay their employees. They will use their $6,000 Kiva loan to purchase the raw ingredients to make 3,000 units of all natural deodorant (their #1 selling product) and to pay their employees. 

In the future, Katherine and Brooke would like to grow their e-commerce presence, because of its efficiency and inexpensive overhead. They would also like to sell wholesale in high end boutiques and potentially go global. Growing sales will allow them more time to focus on creating new all natural products.

Check out KB Pure Essentials online at: http://www.kbpureessentials.com

loans.use: to purchase the raw ingredients to make 3,000 units of all natural deodorant (their #1 selling product) and to pay their employees
